text: I could not have asked for a better Dr. and staff. They have all been amazing to work with. Dr. Hedden and his team have answered every email I have sent. Dr. Hedden knows exactly what he is doing , and he is very good at it. He gave me exactly what I wanted. Very happy!

name: Adriane Lowe
text: I am currently on my 4th day of recovery. I traveled from Atlanta to Birmingham for the Hedden experience. I received 445cc Silicon and they are beautiful! You would think I've been had them. I had to be alone for surgery due to Covid. Dr.Hedden and his staff gave me extra attention and was very patient with me. I highly recommend him. Thank you Dr. Hedden for my new confidence!

name: Google user
text: I should have trusted my gut and never came back or booked surgery here. Dr. Hedden came off as very judgmental, lacked any bedside manner and completely botched my procedure. I got liposuction on a few trouble areas and I was left with large dips and large brown scars at every single place he cut. The scars look like very large, dark moles. It’s been 5 years and they are still there, hardly faded at all. Please avoid him for any type of liposuction procedures. I can’t speak to his work on other types of procedures since I did not get anything else. Best of luck, trust your intuition, and only go with doctors that don’t make your alarm bells go off. Severely regret this mutilation to my body and waste of thousands of dollars.

name: Amber Waters
text: I had my implants on top of the muscle with doctor Gunn and he did an amazing job I am so happy I was able to pick up my babies The day of surgery able to raise my arms I didn't miss any days of work my surgery on Friday and I went back to work on a Sunday night Make sure that your happy and Explain everything I couldn't be more happy with results Such a blessed recovery such an amazing job by everybody very personable makes you feel very comfortable I couldn't imagine a better experience 😀

text: I love Heather she is just awesome!! Thank you Dr. Hedden and your staff for a wonderful experience. I got a Breast Augmentation on 12/3/2020 with 600cc's. I can't wait for March when Dr. Hedden does my tummy tuck.

name: Kennady Gonzalez
text: It’s only been a week since my breast augmentation (500 cc silicone) and I’m already so happy with the results!! Dr Hedden did an amazing job and all of the staff is super friendly!! If you’re debating on where to go for your surgery, choose this place! Highly recommend!!

text: I absolutely love this place. It is such a laid back envioronment and the nurses and doctors are so kind! Dr. Hedden is great! name: vakeshia ellison
text: This place is BS. I had a surgery scheduled and had to cancel due to the flu. They are quick to get your money but will come up with EVERY excuse for a reason to not give you your money back upon giving reasonable documentation. I wouldn't recommend this place to a dog.

resp.text:
We’re sorry she feels this way. We always review the cancellation policy with everyone. One you schedule everything is completely refundable up unless you cancel with less then two weeks notice as we have already by this time committed to all the anesthesia and OR personnel and have to pay them for your surgery that was scheduled. So a small percentage is retained if cancellation is with to short of a notice as we are charged from those professionals for scheduling them. Even with that being said if someone cancelled because of illness even if it is the day of surgery typically that money is left on the account to be applied to their surgery in the future. We do everything we can to help patients as well as try to make the cost of surgery affordable to everyone.

Dr Hedden

name: Just Jashon
text: Had a saline BA done with Dr.Hedden on 3-7-16 and my experience was very pleasant! His facility is very immaculate and clean,his staff,including nurses and people involved with surgery are very kind and have great bedside manner. He's a top notch surgeon with great results. I won't ever go anywhere else for my PS needs. Highly recommend!

name: Crystal Barnett
text: Dr. Hedden did my BA April of 2016 I had it done through my belly button I had a few problems going into the surgery as far as my breast was not symmetrical as well as they were tubular in shape so he wanted me to have realistic expectations I would not have the perfect breast that I wanted but let me just say I believe he was impressed with how beautiful they actually turned out I still like a little bit on the final results I ended up having to wear a shoelace cast for like 6 weeks after the surgery because of my folds being off quite a bit due to my breast not being symmetrical to start with I hated that thing it wasn't very comfortable at all but I can honestly say this it works and  if you do exactly what he tells you to do during the recovery process and stick to it no matter how uncomfortable it is to wear the shoelace cast  you will achieve great results!!! Dr. Hedden is the best and very skilled at what he does!!!!!

name: Belinda Carroll
text: First off I'd like to say I'm very Happy with my surgery and Dr. Schaffer. He did a wonderful job. I'm not happy with his office staff. They often don't return messages. It's like the right hand doesn't know what the left is doing. You can call today ask a question, you don't get a call back so you wait a couple of days and call, a different person looks at your message and it's not what you asked at the start. If you want a good plastic surgeon he's your guy. If you expect good communication with staff, not so good.

name: Erica Cleveland
text: One of the worst experiences I've ever had with a medical professional . Dr.Hedden at my consult seemed nice enough it was a bit of a wait but he apologized for it no biggie or so I thought . I must admit that they do tell you that you probably won't go back immediately you will have some wait. Well I was coming from out of town my surgery was to be at 9:30 am I didn't get called back until 12:20. I had asked what was taking so long as I was paying for a caretaker by the hour and hadn't eaten the night before, I asked the Dr. personally about it he said sorry but sometimes in surgery things happen it shouldn't be much longer he seemed to get agitated but still professional offered me a refund I stated no since I had waited over 3 hours by this time please proceed as soon as possible. While another hour and 30 minutes go by with me in this thin bathroom no nurse or anything comes to check on me I put my clothes back on and ask the lady at the front how much longer she states she didn't know and she went and found someone. By this time I go back to my room then comes in Patrick who was very nice and was going to start my IV, they called him out of the room then comes in Nurse Manager Win (Nguyen ). She states how can we make you happy I'm like at this point just get my arm surgery started and I'm happy I told her I was fine I just wanted to get it over with since I have come all this way. She states I dont think we can make you happy you're going to give the practice a "bad review" I said I am about the lack of communication but I can't say anything about surgery. I was like I'm over it I just want to get my arm lift done so I can go home. She basically said they didn't want to do it because I complained about the wait time. Who or what person taught these people business etiquette I wasn't loud I just stated that I would be giving a review to let people know how they treat their patients. I stated again I'm fine she extended a discount on cool sculpting I accepted I thought everything was fine. Dr. Hedden comes in very very nasty and stated we're not doing your surgery and we're giving you a full refund and I told him I was fine I wasn't happy but not angry enough not to have my surgery after I have waited over 5 hours he storms out wouldn't hear it. They didn't give me a on refund on my travel or hotel, informed the spa not to do my cool sculpting, and also would not honor a gift certificate that I was given. I wasn't all smiles and giggles, but I didn't get loud or curse. The staff couldn't believe it and said they had never heard of such. Please don't go there Dr. Hedden is a bully and don't dare ask to question why you are waiting or you too could be out of money and time beware stay away awful !!!!

resp.text: We always try to do everything to accommodate patient's. What happened in this case which she is not disclosing is that she requested a late arrival time. She was told in doing that she could not be given an exact start time but that she would be following other cases. She expressed that she was upset about the wait when she first arrived. Our office manager offered her and her care giver a free spa service for the inconvenience. She seemed to be happy at that point. When she was brought back I explained we were sorry for any delay but that when someone ask for a delayed start time that it becomes more dependent on the cases before them which are not something that can be predicted. She then explained she was upset that she was paying for a sitter she hired and was having to pay her. I explained we would pay for the sitters time for her delay. Again she seemed happy with that. She then told the nurse that she also wanted some other procedures for free or she would write a bad review if she was not given them. She had voiced this to several staff members. I then went back into the room and told her I did not feel comfortable operating on someone who was blackmailing the practice in an attempt to get procedures for free. That this was not the right way to start a doctor patient relationship and that we would offer her a full refund and cover her sitter for any inconvenience but that I could not proceed now that threats were made in an attempt to get more free services when we had already tried to do so much for her. She then went up to the spa and asked for monetary exchange for the free spa services we had just given her. We always do everything we can to help our patients and do whatever we can to make their experience as nice as possible but this was not our fault. There is a reason we are one of the busiest practices in the country and it's because we do great work and take care of our patients. We treat everyone as if they were family. But a doctor can not operate on someone when the physician patient relationship breaks down as it did here with her attempts to blackmail the practice.

text: If I could give a 0 I would. I had the plastic surgery from hell with Dr Hedden. I would NEVER recommend him for anything. They were 5 hours behind the day I got my surgery. I went almost two days without food or water. When I went back to have the IV put in, because I was so dehydrated it took two different people to stick me about 12 times. Finally got back and they stuck me in the supply closet/room where all the implants was. I was like what the heck. I should have walked out. I told the anesthesia to please give me something for nausea before they woke me up, due to I will start thowing up. I woke up in a wheelchair, at my car, 8pm at night, throw up bowl and throwing my guts up. The anesthesia basically said okay to my husband and took the wheelchair and took off. I felt like I had been hit by a train. I thought I was truly going to die that night.  I was sick and hurt for days. When I went back I was so extremely disappointed in my upper and lower eye lift. Dr Hedden was like, oh well that’s all I can do. Long story short, breast augmentation drop huge in 2 years, I had them removed by another surgeon. The other surgeon also told me Dr Hedden did not remove the fatty tissue in my lower eyelid, so that’s why I still had sagging. I was also told Dr Hedden’s office was known for breast implants in and out, in and out. Trust me, you get what you pay for.  Go to a better surgeon!!! That was a waste and two years to pay off $7,000.00.

resp.text: We have searched through our system and there is no patient by this name. I personally checked every Glenda as well as the one and only Tippett but who has a different first name. I looked at all of those patients charts to see if anyone may have had the surgery this person talks about and no one did. So she most likely has us confused with another practice. I’m going to respond to this review though just to give some clarification on our practice and how this could not have happened. First of all no one is ever asked or told to go without food or water for more than 6 hours before their scheduled surgery time. That’s just no safe. Second this person states she was put in a closet. Not really sure what practice could really look like that but ours obviously does not. Anyone reading this can simply take the virtual tour which shows our operating rooms and see that we are probably the nicest surgery center in Alabama and with cardiac size operating rooms. So I really believe she has us confused with another practice. We do all types of cosmetic surgery and are world renowned for all types of cosmetic breast surgery as well. But for the last 15 years I have always charged the same price. I just think that’s doing right by the Patient by trying to make plastic surgery more affordable. But what she put as what she paid is nowhere closed to what we charge for the procedures she states she had. We always remove fat when lid surgery is performed but some fat has to remain around the orbit to cushion and protect the eye. We also have some of the best anesthesia staff in the city and always give patients nausea medication and never have someone leave before their wide awake and able to take care of themselves. Anesthesia does not wheel them to their car. Our recovery nurses help them outside. Lastly I give my cell number to every single patient that comes through our office if someone has a problem I would hope they would actually call the number. I give out my number because I truly do care about all of our patients that’s why I even still make house calls if needed.

resp.text: I am sorry you are unhappy with your results. We did perform muscle repair. As much as could be performed. Tummy tucks do not treat fatty tissue in and around the intestines or the thickness of fatty tissue to the upper abdomen. We do the best possible for our patients given the anatomy. That is what was done in this case as well. Remember the best tummy tucks are always when we are at the smallest size we can get to prior to surgery. I think it would do you well to come back in and see what can be done for you.

name: S B
text:
Dr. Hedden placed my implants wrong, causing muscle flex deformity and lateral malposition. I have contacted his office serveral times to discuss the issues and was brushed off. I will now be seeking a malprimalpr lawsuit, as the implants have caused more and more pain over the years and made my job as an exotic dancer impossible to perform. I can not even look in the mirror without crying and I suffer a lot of pain. I would not recommend this man to anyone. He acts like he is the best doctor until you have an issues .my deformity issues showed as soon as the swelling was down and I was informed that this was his mistake. I am also suffering CC due to him placing textureed implants when this was not what I was asked for at all. His resolution to this issue was to just remove the inplants he placed, leaving me with scars and saggy breasts. I plan to gather all of the women I have found in online support groups that he has wronged.
Edit*** I am most definitely one of your patients and have the serial numbers on a card to prove that you used a textured Sientra implant on me. When I confronted Dr. Hedden about this and the double bubble within weeks after surgery, he told me that he would remove my implants and not offer any money back or to replace the implants. I wore all support recommended and didn't try to go back to dancing until years after surgery, which I can also prove. I also have records from a plastic surgeon that I saw in Georgia within months after my surgery, who informed me that a doctor should not have used the implants used, neither texture nor size, neither of which Dr. Hedden spoke to me about before or after surgery. All he did waswbrush me off. I have been suffering since surgery and plan to sue if something is not done to make this right, and especially since you are now denying the use of textured implants. Also, I don't have my full name on this site and use a nickname for my own safety.

resp.text:
We tried to find this patient in our system but no one comes up with her name or anything close to it. We also do not use textured implants as the carry a risk of patients developing a form of cancer. So I’m not sure if this is a patient of ours or even a true patient.  But I will try to respond to her issues. We do perform close to a thousand implants each year and do have several patients who are also dancers. I always try to stress this to dancers ..that you must wear very good support during the healing process and reframe from dancing for the first 3-4 weeks. Otherwise your pocket is not healed enough to prevent migration of the implant down and to the side which is the direction the muscle wants to push it. Patients that come in with no droopiness and wanting a good small implant do not have their muscle changed and so most of the time the implant will not shift much. Also going above the muscle would typically not lead to this but patients would be at higher risk for rippling and capsular contracture (CC). But if someone wants either a very large implant or they have severe droopiness then it will lead to some of the inferior pectoral muscle having to be detached to allow the larger implant to fit or the droopiness to be camouflaged. Thus running the risk of lateral drift if the muscles are used too soon such as an exotic dancer going back to work right away and or not wearing support. So it is very important to always follow the guidelines from your surgeon to minimize any risk of complications. We always offer bliss insurance which would cover any cost of fixing any issues as well. So I’m not sure she is a true patient or our patient because she would have most likely obtained this.
Addendum; she called our office yesterday and is using a different name here but she is very mistaken she does not have textured implants. My nurse called the implant company and gave the serial number to them as well. This is not the appropriate placed to discuss these issues as she should come back in and see us but she wishes to slander us and make accusations that are completely wrong. When someone comes in with droopiness , one breast lower than the other and their breast drifting to the sides because of their chest wall you have a few options all of which are always offered to patients. Asymmetry and droopiness.. best treated with a lift with implants ( cost twice as much and leaves scar that not all patients want ) or biplaner breast augmentation ( less cost , less , scaring but carries the risk of feeling the implant at the bottom and slight double bubble) or going above the muscle (requires silicone, higher risk of capsular contracture). If she really wants this to be educational for you she would consent to her pictures being shown which will show where she started and where she was 3 months out and let everyone judge for themselves. Now it’s very easy to seek a second opinion and a doctor not that busy to say ( without even seeing your before pictures) that something was done wrong. You must understand not all doctors offer all options and some have no experience with biplaner approaches. They will be quick to say something was done wrong so they can charge you to be reoperated on. Always be careful of the doctor giving an opinion without seeing your before pictures. Again this is not the best way to discuss your concerns.

I am very disappointed about my smart lipo result done at Heden Plastic surgery one month ago. My back look exactly how it was before the surgery. It is norm and sensitive. name: Lindsey Pope
text: My experience with Dr. Hedden was the best! I had a breast augmentation in July of 2012 and it was okay. I did 290cc of saline I can't say anything bad about that surgeon. I just wanted an upgrade I wanted them bigger and I wanted silicone! I had a friend that went to dr. Hedden and she was very pleased with him, so I decided I scheduled a consultation with him it took me about 2 months to get a consultation. I was in the office for probably 15 mins before I was called into a room to see dr. Hedden! Me and my boyfriend played around with the samples while we waited to see what size we liked. I was kinda hard for me to tell what it would look like since I already had implants. Originally I was wanting to go to a 450! But me and my boyfriend continued to talk about it and said we really couldn't even tell a difference so we picked 500 (he wanted me to go a lot bigger being a male of course) but I researched and researched females my size and 500 cc of silicone gel, and I truly liked the size and I felt those would look best! My consultation was July the 14th and that day we scheduled the surgery for august the 10th. My surgery was scheduled for 8 I got back in the room about 9 around 10 the took me back for surgery. I remember waking up around 12:15 and I left at 12:30, I ended up getting 525cc silicone gel! It was a super easy process. I felt like everything was done in a timely manor. I stayed the night the night of my surgery and had to follow up post op day one, while I was there I got some juvaderm injections in my lips! It was pretty painful but I have to say I absolutely love them! They a beautiful I've received so many compliments on my lips! I'm now post op day 5 I can pretty much do anything I'm still a little sore! I will return to work Friday and I can't wait to show off my lips! I highly recommend dr. Hedden and his facility. He truly listens to you and your concerns. He puts his patients first. The staff is awesome as well, they make you feel at home. And the anesthesiologist was great to! The day after I got home I had a get well soon card from his facility which was super kind. If I could do it all over again I wouldn't change one thing! In my opinion Dr. hedden in the BEST plastic surgery!

text: I went in for a consultation for a breast reduction and my information was never submitted to my insurance company. the only thing I recorded after I left there was a bill in the mail.

resp.text: I'm sorry you are upset with our practice. When patient's present for evaluation for breast reductions information is only sent to the insurance company if the patient anatomy meets the criteria based on our exam and measurements. I know sometimes the insurance company will tell the patient all they need is a letter stating its necessary and then it will be covered. But that is not the case, they require the doctor to make sure it meets the requirements or they will not approve it. We always try to explain this to every patient so they understand the process. I am sorry she felt we let her down. I think it would be worse to get your hopes up that it would be covered when we know from experience it will not based on your anatomy.

I noticed that every one was wearing mask and that they had they on correctly and that every where they hand sanitizer in multiple places. The tech Les, both receptionist and Dr Drew were nice and professional. Dr Drew listened to me and he was so kind and knowledgeable of what was going on with my eyes. I have got my new prescription  yet but I will try to do another review when I do. So far I am very impressed.

name: Brie Williams
text: I really enjoy my choice to have eye care associates as my provider. The staff are so nice and friendly.

name: Carmanita Monroe
text: The staff and Dr. Drew were awesome. We are extremely pleased with the level of care.

name: Christy Pierce
text: Very professional and friendly atmosphere. They are always very helpful. At this time they are really in appliance with the "covid-19" rules and regulations.

name: Roderick Brown
text:
I normally get my eyeexam/glasses from Walmart, but I missed my appointment due to work and was told it would be a month and a half before the next opening.

Luckily enough Eyecare Associates was close by and could see me in a week instead.  The staff was very kind and the doctor was very helpful.   Especially so to the point that he gave me a full explanation of the purpose for each test and what the results from each meant.  I was at ease when he showed me I had a small bleed in one of my eyes that he was sure was not a serious issue.  Comforting to know.

I had a particular style of glasses that was not in office, so the doctor's saleswoman worked with me to find the closest thing to it and ordered three choices for me to have sent to her to try on

Overall, I'm happy and will come again.

name: Wendy Boggan
text: Very nice and knowledgeable group!

name: Darlene Cockrell
text: The staff and the Doctor are very pleasant courteous they make you feel welcome and want to come again

name: Melissa Payne
text: I had a wonderful experience.  The doctor and staff were the best I have experienced anywhere.  I am thankful that they were able to work me in when I had an eye injury.

name: Blake Wood
text: I had a great experience today seeing my doctor and although I did not need much than a regular eye exam. The staff was friendly.

name: Karen McAdams
text: I always have a great experience. Friendly staff. My whole family is going.

Seriously I will never fp pr see any other Dr. He explained where my last doctor never  did.  I now consider these folks my people.  Thanks alot Yall for making me feel as if yall truly care

text: Some of the friendliest people I have encountered as a new patient. Very fast at taking me back. They were also very thorough. We will go back with a doubt. I came out of there knowing evrything I needed to know about my sight and conditions. Great people!!!👍👍😊

However it was long wait to see the doctor an hour after my scheduled appt.  & I had to call them to find out if my perscription were ready they had been sitting there for weeks. However, I like my frames and they are informative.

text: Dr. Hang and the staff were fantastic. The testing process was explained and I was very satisfied with the process from start to finish. I will be going back.

text: My experience at eyecare  in hueytown is great the people at the front desk to all the other workers in back.They are friendly and help you out in my case couldn't see after eye exam trying to pick glasses they all get together and say oh I like those or no the others are better looking...I give 5 STARS.!!

text: These guys are awesome they take really good care of their patients and i noticed every single one keep a smile the whole time i was their their my eye care doctors now

name: Terry Farrington
text: Love Dr Hill and his staff.  They have taken care of us for years and go above and beyond to accommodate us and make you feel that you are getting the best eye care in a very friendly, professional manner and you are.

name: Lisa Woodall
text: The staff were very helpful and nice,and I like to give kudos to the African American receptionist.Lisa woodall

name: Michelle Dennis
text: Friendly with great service!

name: amy earnest
text: I appreciate their service and help.Plus They are so nice .

name: Caye Mcculloh Griffin
text: Extremely impressed! Thank you!

name: Rita Davis
text: A great place to have your medical procedures done. The Staff is awesome! The process is organized so well. Dr Matt Davis is my Orthopedic surgeon and very caring and knowledgeable. I recommend this location.

name: Britt Millsaps
text: I had a very good experience here. The staff was friendly, answered all my questions before I arrived and the day of. They made sure I took something for potential nausea before surgery and gave me stuff during. Someone very thoughtfully put my glasses on as I was waking up which was incredibly helpful, feeling so disoriented coming off anesthesia and all. Definitely did their best to keep me calm. They had me eat and drink to make sure I could keep food down before I left and had me out the door quickly. So much better than waiting in a big hospital all day for discharge.

name: Christopher Sign
text: Watch out for surprises!  In my experience the care was just OK and the billing will offer a nice surprise. I just received a bill 2 YEARS after my service. Imagine getting a bill 2 years later - think about that. From my experience I would not recommend. Hard Pass.  Several other centers & orthos I recommend. This is for the facility on Southlake.

name: Nichole Kee
text: We have been pleased in the past, but today, my husband was not treated for nausea after his epidural block. They wheeled him out while holding a vomit bag and throwing up. He was told because they pretreated with Phenergan that he could only have Zofran. They only gave 25 milligrams in a pill form. You can take 50 milligrams. They refused to help him even by letting him stay with IV until he felt better. We will not go back!

name: Christie Musso Bruce
text: I had to have a pain block today and when we got there they told me I had a $300.00 copay. They would not take payments and I have been unemployed a whole year now. They made us pay $150.00 today and made us sign another charge of $150.00 for two more weeks and made us sign it. I live off of disability and this is really a hardship. Not only that, you have to pay the anesthesia doctor 180.00 up front with no payment plan. They refused to do the procedure unless we paid. Also, they don’t call you in an office to discuss this, they humiliate you in front of the whole lobby. I would choose another outpatient clinic that will work with you on payments. Now I have to struggle to pay rent just to get hardly no relief in pain. It’s sad when it’s all about money.

name: Ken Adams
text: I had Carpal Tunnel release surgery and from the moment I got there, to the time I left the facility, everyone that works there was very professional. Everyone makes you feel like family and wants to treat you in the same fashion. If you're looking for a great place to go, I highly recommend both Southlake Orthopedics and Medplex Outpatient Surgery Center. Thank you to Dr. Smith and everyone at Medplex.

name: maharet64
text: I have been here several times for lower back epidurals.  I have always had positive experiences.  The staff is professional and courteous.  The office is clean and neat.  They have the surgeries running on time each time I've been there.  They always call to follow up to see how I am doing and then send a survey for my opinion of the service and facilities.  I would definitely recommend it.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: Staff is super nice, answered all questions, and very professional. Much easier process than having the procedure at the hospital. Glad Dr. Bhuta performs surgery here.

name: Jeannie R
text: Horrible experience...arrived a few min before 7a.m... for a spinal injection procedure...having terrible low back pain..difficulty walking...sat in the waiting room for 2 hrs and 20 min... in a straight back chair ..trying to lean over or lounge...impossible...severe pain....Dr. Introduced himself.. 25 seconds..never had met him before..never saw him again...... post procedure blood pressure was 92/54.. I was asked to stand and get into a wheelchair...could not...legs felt like jelly...finally was able to flop into the chair...nurse disappeared...in a hurry...was wheeled to my car by another very young woman...managed to flop into the passenger seat.  Was given no pain med Rx ...an instruction sheet said to call for a post procedure appt.... I called the # on the instruction sheet...rang and rang ..no answer, no voice mail.... I called Southlake and told that operator no one answered at Medplex....she told me there was nothing she could do and I needed to keep trying.  ...I gave up....would never recommend this place.

name: Angie L.
text: Taking very well care of, great bedside manner from Dr. Krauss and his staff! Let the healing begin!

name: Marcia Neff
text: They are very thorough and kind.

name: KES Account
text: I have had numerous epidural back blocks done here and in my opinion you will never have a bad nurse or staff member here and the facility is top of the line, God bless them all for going above and beyond the all of duty!

name: Michael Ashworth
text: Waiting room is freezing ! . I never complain or send my food back at a restaurant,  but I did say something about the air. They said" it's not a Heat pump " ...if that's the case then it would work better . DUH ....But the PROBLEM IS  the freaking thermostat is set on "ON"   and has been blowing HARD  for two hours now.....it should be on AUTO . The receptionist area is obviously on another thermostat along with bathrooms. They leave the sliding glass open until they get cold and then close it.  Most in building have 4 or more years of college but no common sense.

name: Amy Brightbill
text: friendly and highly efficient.

name: Karen Curran
text: Best place to get eye exam and glasses.  The staff made my visit enjoyable!

name: Paula Turner
text:
They need to have a a bigger and better selection of glasses
I was told to go to denny vision but I went to my home town place wasn't really happy with the glasses that I got but I didn't have alot of choices.
The eye doctor is a very sweet and concerned lady. I really like her.
Thank you so much Tammy Wallace

name: Harry Jarvis
text: Everyone at EyeCare is extremely knowledgeable and very efficient. Dr Tammy explains everything.

name: Sweet T's Nerdiness
text: Absolutely amazing experience! Every member of the staff was kind and welcoming. Any questions I asked during my appointment was answered with a wealth of knowledge and passion for what they do. I was told what to expect and why they were doing each step of my eye exam, that alone creates a great atmosphere. In all I would highly recommend OD Tammy Wallace and her staff! Thank you

name: Lynn Gilley
text: The nurse and doctor were great. Super polite and informative. But.... I went in there after being told twice that I would only have to pay my $20 copay up front. Upon checking in, i was told it would be $144. When checking out, it had changed again to $203! I'm on a fixed income....so much for paying my power bill this month.... Had I known this, I would have cancelled. Who needs electricity and heat, right?

resp.text: Lynn, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry about this billing issue -- this is definitely not the experience we want our patients to have. I'd like to look into what happened -- could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: Haley Pyle
text: Wonderful experience! Everyone there was so nice, and Dr. Wallace did a great job of explaining everything to me. 10 out of 10 recommend and do not think I will ever go anywhere else as long as they are in Ozark.

name: Shandria Johnson
text: Absolutely AMAZING! I ripped my last contact this morning and they squeezed me in when everyone else was booked out for at least a month. Every single staff is extremely friendly and comforting. I was given all the knowledge I needed up front to make decisions. They repeated anything that I didn’t understand. They made sure I was happy and given all of my options. I’m new to the area but I highly recommend them! If their service was this amazing during a pandemic I can’t only imagine how great it is normally. Thank you ladies!

name: Linda Tiedeman
text: Great employees. The exam is very thorough and you feel they truly care about your eyesight.

name: Brian Shinholster
text: I’ve been totally impressed with the professionalism That was displayed Throughout  My visit. They were courteous as well as knowledgeable about there product, I will definitely give them two thumbs up or 10 out of 10!

name: Darrell Langford
text: This was my first visit, and I was thoroughly impressed.  The staff was very courteous and professional. Left the facility feeling I had received the best care possible.

name: Willie Faniel
text: Once I did my eye exam, Dr. Wallace explained everything to me in detail, she really understood what I was going through. That really put my mind at ease. Very professional & understanding.  Thanks guys 👊

name: Lorianne Hairston
text: It was great at this Eyecare Dr. APPOINTMENT NO LONG WAIT AND EVERY ONE WAS NICE AND GREAT AND TOOK THEIR TIME TO EXPLAIN WHEN I HAD A QUESTION YES MY KIND OF PLACE NO LONG WAIT.

text: Love Dr. Wallace... she is kind and extremely thorough. I always have a pleasant experience when I visit and leave with a good peace of mind. The staff are very friendly as well... highly recommend!

I was told back in early January that my glasses would arrive at the Enterprise location, and that they would call me whenever they arrive (they said it would take only a couple of weeks).
This is late March. I’m very disappointed and I’ll never waste my time with FEC EVER again.

resp.text: Lexi, I'm Cassie. I'm sorry about the delays with your glasses. I'd like to look into what's happening with them. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

text: Thought it was little pricey , even with vsp insurance.  But over all Tammy is awesome.  She's the main reason I go there.  I'll pay extra for good service.  Assistants were awesome also.

There were also oversized chairs for those of us in an oversize class.  Very nice selections of frames. The entire staff presented professional appearances.  They were very personable and treated you as a long time client. Based on my first visit, I would highly recommend Dr. Wallace and her staff.

name: Phenishial Glenn

resp.text: We are so glad to hear this Karen - we know getting out can be a little bit overwhelming at this time so we want to make sure we keep you safe without comprising your eye care and experience.

name: Victor Ingram
text:
Overpriced for an exam definitely wouldn't recommend them if I was going blind and my seeing eye dog would go blind as well would rather take my chances with the blind seeing eye dog.
$180 for a contact lens exam and they do not even accept all the insurance that is provided not to mention I'm a federal employee and they don't accept the insurance that I pay for definitely will not be visiting again time wasted and not willing to pay $180 just for a contact lens exam

name: Carolyn Mahone
text: Very friendly atmosphere. Staff and Doctor Wallace are great. I would highly recommend.

name: Vicki Shehane
text: Very professional and efficient. Thoroughly explained before and after exam procedures. Have been looking for a new eye doctor and will be joining their patient list. Would highly recommend them.

name: Tracy Walsh
text: Fast and efficient service today at Family Eye Center. I was able to get back to my job in under an hour. Awesome!!

name: Montana Long
text: I am very pleased with my experience at Family Eye and Laser! The staff was amazing. They were very informative and helpful. Erin Jones made me feel right at home. She helped explain things I've never understood about my eyes. Jessica Garrett was very helpful with finding the glasses that I actually love. I would recommend this eye center over any other place.

resp.text: Ashley, Thanks for the incredible review and for giving our team a nice shout out! We appreciate your review!

name: martha beach

And my goodness, do they all look beautiful too!

resp.text: Brian, thank you so much for your kind words about our team and the ladies loved your complement! ; )

text: Been a customer since Feb 2017 ...excellent service and been back 4 times now, most outstanding customer service. THE Doc was so calm and explained things that even a 5 year old could understand. I came here because l saw the same when l brought my Grandson here 5 years ago....cannot find better optometry clinic for kids or adults!!!

name: Susan Mathis
text: Awesome experience will go back yearly. Great prices. Friendly staff.they go extra mile for senior citizens. Dr.Tammy is a blessing.Highly recommend Dr.Tammy.

name: Lisa Willis
text: Would never go to this eye clinic ever again!!!😡😡 These people ripped me off big time!!! I paid 120, even after they did my insurance! I usually don’t pay that for exam.  The only reason why I went here was because I was in need to get my eyes checked and after quarantine, everything was booked! the doc I usually go to is dr MacArthur’s office! At least I paid 45 after insurance along with contacts and the fittings comes with everything . The 110 did not included contacts! Just exam 40 and they overcharged me for fitting, 70 dollars!!! Idc what they said and yes it was like throw money down the drain. I had to order my contacts somewhere else. And they also go my vision wrong. Last year I was a -4.50 on one eye and the other is a -5.00. There’s no way it got reduced from those to -4.25 and -4.00!!! They made me so angry that I was screaming my head off cussing over the phone about them ripped me off!!! I want my money back ! I shouldn’t even give him a one star!!!

name: Sandra George
text: Great staff and place to go for your eye care. Dr. Wallace is very knowledgeable.

name: Bernadette Brock
text: Everyone was so helpful and kind I thoroughly enjoyed my experience

name: Justin Reed
text: I have always great service here from the time I walk in to the time I walk out. I was greeted by Kimberly at the front desk with a smile. In less than 1 minute, I was taken in the back room, where Lisa went through my routine eye exam and then, she took me to the back and Dr. Wallace was working on my vision asking questions and answering my questions about concerns.  After the eye exam, I was taken to choose my frames with the help of Jessica. She helped me choose some frames and took me step by step on my lenses. It is always a wonderful experience, when I go in there and I would recommend anyone needing eye care to go to the Family Eye & Laser in Ozark, Alabama.

name: Harold Phillips
text: During my last visit I had the most pleasant experience ever during an eye exam. Everyone was so thorough and precise and professional but yet warm. Thank you Dr Wallace and team!

resp.text: Harold, we were so glad to have you in our office recently! Thanks for the incredibly kind review of our team!

name: Lamoina Brooks
text: Dr. Wallace is exceptional.  She is thorough, patient and  knowledgeable with a personal touch in caring for her patient. I highly recommend her for your eye care needs. Her staff is great.

resp.text: Lamoina, we love Dr. Wallace too and we are so pleased you had an excellent experience in our office recently.

name: Cynthia Messick
text: As always I am quite satisfied.

name: Kimberly Henderson
text: Clean, personable and up to date on the latest technology.   Love Dr. Wallace and her staff.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review Kimberly!

name: Sandy Gainey
text: This office was very flexible with working me in during my lunch hour and pretty much at the last minute and I appreciated that.  Since I felt there was a problem with my prescription they helped me go through the tests again to confirm it’s accuracy.  I believe we found the source of the problem I was having.  The only reason I didn’t give them 5 stars is that out of four different assistants who helped me this day other than the eye doctor only one of them was friendly and cheerful.  The other three just tolerated me.  The doctor’s great.  I recommend using her business, would be better if she updated her staff with people who are happy to help others.

name: Kim Newman
text: Everyone was very kind and  helpful to me and my mother thank you guys for  everything💕

resp.text: We see patients as family and we are so glad to have you and your mother in the office!

name: Robert Himes
text: Family Eye and Laser, in Ozark turned out to be one of the most pleasant medical appointments I've had in quite a while. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Every process was explained to me and the doctor was thorough in her examination of my eyes, including the complications that diabetes can cause. I'd recommend this facility to anyone in need of a comprehensive eye exam.

resp.text: We are so glad you had a great experience at our office! Thanks for the great review!

name: Logan Trower
text: Kimberly, Jessica, Erin & Dr. Tammy Wallace were all so pleasant, friendly and informative! They answered all my questionS, explained each procedure & made me feel comfortable. I had to get glasses and they were very helpful with assisting me in which ones to get too! Would definitely recommend Ozark Family Eye & Laser!

resp.text: Dr. Wallace and her team loved your shout out! We are glad you had a pleasant experience in our office! Thanks for your review!

name: Matthew Godwin
text: Awesome experience at Family Eye & Laser! Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Cassidy did an awesome job of explaining all the small tests and was very caring. Dr. Wallace did a fantastic job of explaining the pictures of my eyes, which I had never experienced at other eye clinics. Would recommend this clinic above all others.

resp.text: We are so pleased you had an excellent experience at Family Eye and Laser in Ozark. It sounds like Dr. Wallace and Cassidy to excellent care of you. Thank you so much for your kind review!

name: Desiree Hooper
text: They were all extremely friendly and helpful. Explained everything they were doing and what their lingo was so I wasn’t confused with what was going on.

name: Doris Fenn
text: Dr.Wallace Erin, Lisa, Jessica and Kimberly made our visit so comfortable. Thanks Dr. Wallace! Jimmy's eyesight greatly improved with new contacts; yay!

name: Little Mama Roberts
text: Kimberly at the front desk is the bes . She always has a smile and is very ready to help with any questions. Jessica was great. She and my daughter were conversing about Netflix. Cheyenne and Lisa were a great help as well. But, Dr. Wallace takes the cake. She is the ABSOLUTE BEST!!! I have been other places, but always come back to see her. She does everything that she knows in order to treat her patients. Will never go anywhere else!!!

name: Shelley Brooks

text:
Dr Wallace was very nice everybody was really nice professional we had no wait time the longest part of the visit was picking out my son's glasses I am looking for to next year and another visit they did this scan on his eyes that showed everything in the. I recommend it
It's well worth the money a very happy parent

name: Dr. Shaletta Borders

text: First visit to Family Eye Center, really nice staff and make the process of an eye exam more pleasant. For myself I just couldn't afford the glasses, too much over my budget. text: I had an infection on my eyelid and just moved to yhe area and was in alot of pain.the eye lid it self was inflamed really bad.so i located a eye center only a couple miles from me.one of my sisters had recommend a Dr.Tammy Wallace.so she had made an appt for me ironically the following day.i was somewhat skeptical of seeing someone i had no ideal of what there professionals would be like.i was there maybe 15 mins and a young lady came and greeted me took me to a room and seemed very concerned of the problem.soon after her exam Dr.Wallace came in and time with me checked out the problem and said she thought she could basically resolve my problem.had me to go home and do these few things and to come back in a week and if that wasnt the problem she would seek extra testing.she gave me a prescription of antibioctics.within a couple days the swelling had gone down.on the next visit she was pleased of the progress.that Dr knew exactly what it was before i had lft her office.Dr.Wallace is truly a godsent for me.very knowledgeable and a personality that could light up four city blocks.my thanks to her superior service and bedside manor.only wish there were more Drs like her around.

name: Amanda McGough
text: We trust Dr. Johnston and his staff with all of our fur babies and are so thankful to have them close to home. Dr. Johnston goes beyond most and takes the time to explain and educate clients. He is fair and just in his pricing and does not perform unnecessary tests/procedures. Dr. Johnston is a caring human being who will treat your pets as if they were his own. I strongly admire his love and passion for animals and am very happy we chose his hospital. You will be too.

text: Absolutely wonderful vet. All of my dogs go here and will for the rest of my life. Doc is absolutely wonderful and treats the animals with the compassion and respect that they deserve. name: Curtis Bush
text: Very caring and knowledgable!  Had my Katybug up and going in no time.

name: Cody Burgamy
text: I very highly recommended that you DO NOT use Pike Animal Hospital. This disrespectful vet had our Lab, who had been our family pet for 12 years, for the entire day. Somehow between keeping our dog for 8 hours, charging us 400$ just for bloodwork and X-rays, he failed to notice the 5 pound tumor on our dogs spleen. The tumor caused our dogs spleen to rupture in which we took to another vet in town, who was amazing and their entire staff treated us with the upmost respect and professionalism. They had to do emergency surgery for which our pup didn’t make it. Aside from overcharging us, and missing the key diagnoses for the situation, he was extremely disrespectful and unprofessional to my wife and I. His passive aggressive, sarcastic remarks all of which regarding money, were almost overwhelming. Not to mention that he didn’t even send any meds home with us to help my dog. Neither myself nor anyone I know in our community will be using this vet ever again. He really needs to do some self reflection and learn how to be respectful and professional all the way around.

resp.text:
Mr. Burgamy,
We were perplexed by your scathing review because as you left our office on Monday, Nov. 30th you thanked us repeatedly for all we had done and assured Dr. Johnston and the rest of the staff that Cooper would be returning the next day for the free treatment that had been offered. We were even more surprised by the hostile text from your father that was sent to Dr. Johnston after hours. Thankfully, your father was willing to answer our phone calls and understood our position. It has come to my attention that you may have heard a briefing between the vet and staff, which is often much blunter than the conversation between a vet and the client by necessity. Unfortunately, I believe that this misunderstanding may be the source of this perplexing review. Our staff would never speak to a client in the same manner as they do to each other as we understand that clients do not handle these situations on a regular basis. All conversation that has taken place between you and the staff at Pike Animal has been compassionate and courteous up to this point.
I would like to assure you that our staff does not bring up money unless asked to do so by the client. We did everything in our power to help you and Cooper. I would like to remind you that we did not only offer ICU care for Cooper, which was declined, we also offered 7 days of free out-patient treatment which was also declined. We highly doubt that your other vet offered any free treatment for Cooper.
In veterinary medicine, there are many variables. Cooper presented as a 12-year-old Lab who could not walk; therefore, we were searching for hip dysplasia. Dr. Johnston informed you gently that as we ran more tests more health issues would be found due to Cooper’s age and pre-existing health conditions. Once initial diagnostic testing had been run, Dr. Johnston did inform you that Cooper’s prognosis for recovery was poor. Pike Animal Hospital and Dr. Johnston do not make these calls lightly and run every diagnostic test necessary before coming to this kind of conclusion.
Our heart goes out to you for the loss of your beloved pet. It is unfortunate that you cannot find it in your heart to see things clearly at this time and have chosen to accuse Pike Animal Hospital of any form of neglect or misdiagnoses when so much was offered to you in kindness. We have attempted to reach out and extend our condolences as well as hear your feedback and try to put to rest any miscommunications, however, we have been met with no response. It is regrettable that you misunderstand the situation and this review is all the more disappointing. Each case presented to us is different and as such we must customize treatment accordingly, which we attempted to do for Cooper and would have been able to do better had he returned for further treatment. Please bear in mind that Pike Animal Hospital did everything we could for Cooper. Cooper was a fine dog who the staff here at Pike Animal Hospital, especially Dr. Johnston, grew to love in his short time here. We would like to offer our condolences and hope that you will be grateful for the love and memories Cooper bestowed instead of looking for someone to blame for his loss.

name: Fat Antobelly
text: Best vet I have ever met. He is honest, passionate, and excellent at his craft. Very straightforward and won’t BS you. I know he and the staff are going to put the health of the animal above everything else. Much thanks to all of the staff at Pike Animal Hospital. Only place I’ll ever take my pets.

name: Brandon Grantham
text: I have been Amazed by Dr. Johnston. I’ve never had a vet like Dr. Johnston. He is the most caring Vet that I know and you can see that whenever you talk to him. He loves the animals and treats them as his own. The staff is the best staff I have ever encountered every time I’ve ever needed something they answer my call and are the most polite and kind. They will adjust to your wants whenever you ASK. My last pet to bring them was my female cat who was urinating blood. From the first minute on, Dr. Johnston was completely honest and upfront about her diagnosis. He tried the least invasive treatment first Antibiotics. Which we did for about a month. Me and my Fiancé  thought they worked at different points and eventually we had to have surgery. In 30 YEARS of being a vet he has never done surgery on a female cat with kidney stones. Before her surgery he did not know what she had and told us that it could be a tumor or kidney stone we just didn’t know but he narrowed it down to the 2. Dr. Johnston was truly over the top in his care of our baby who’s surgery was a great Success!!! Removal of 2 Kidney stones.  He treats your baby as his own by not doing extra procedures like sending off blood for testing because he knows treatment is expensive. If needed he will do whatever is necessary because he treats them as his own!!

name: Jonah Magnus Hate Account
text: Absolutely phenomenal. Was an emergency visit. My dog was hit by a car and the Dr and staff were awesome with him. Very professional and caring st the same time. Will recommend to anyone I see. Will also be changing vets for my other dogs.

name: Joshua Whitson
text: They treated our little puppy like their own.  Took him there for parvo.  They saved the little guy.  Now if we have to board him we go there.  The puppy gets excited if you mention the vet or the names of the people that work there.  Highly recommended

name: Laura Dove
text:
Dr. Johnston and his team are absolutely wonderful. They have been caring for my dogs for the last six years and we board our dogs with them when we go out of town. Everyone there genuinely loves the animals they see. They are also very accessible in emergencies. I have had to reach out to Dr. Johnston on a Sunday before, and he returned my call within an hour.

One of my dogs became ill, and Dr. Johnston did everything he could, but we sadly ended up having to make the decision to put him to sleep last year. It was a horrible thing to go through, but because we had been working with Dr. Johnston, I at least had the confidence that it was the right decision. When it was time, the support I got from everyone there was unbelievable. It was comforting to be surrounded by people who truly knew and loved my dog.

name: Hannah Styron
text: I honestly could not say enough great things about the staff at Pike Animal Hospital! From the moment we walked through the door they were so friendly. Our sweet baby had to unexpectedly stay the weekend with them. Every time I called they ensured me that I wasn't bothering them and gave her the best care while she was there. Even after bringing her home they were so friendly when I called with questions. I would so highly recommend them.

name: Andrew “Foster” Reeves
text: Great vet! They have always treated my dog like she was one of their pets.

name: Audra Weaver
text: I used to work here, but even before and after, I still take my pets here. Dr. Johnston loves his animals, his staff, and what they do. He will do everything he can to help you and your furry friends. No large animal practice. Emergency services. Boarding services with great kennels and yards.

name: Laura Thompson
text: The nicest & most honest people. They actually care about you & your precious babies! Always been so hopefully! Thank you for caring about ME!

name: Jordan Sutton
text: Absolutely love Dr. Johnson! Has such a heart for animals. I've been bringing my fur baby here and he's always so sympathetic and compassionate towards even the smallest problem we've had. Tells you just how it is and is very eager to work with you. Staff loves the animals and I've always felt very comfortable leaving my cat over night because I know they go in and check on her and take care of her and even update me on her conditions. Very reasonable prices! Best place in troy to go!

name: Stephanie Caldwell
text: Our dog got attacked and Dr. Johnston and his staff were absolutely wonderful with him. After weeks of stitches,surgery,and being in doggy ICU, We finally got to bring Stinky home!!

name: tori mcquagge
text: Best vet around! Our dog ripped her stitches tonight and we met Dr. Johnston within 30 minutes he made sure she was all good! Definitely recommend him!!!!

name: Jason Sulliman
text:
I am not sure what was more frustrating. It might be that time our cat was attacked by a dog so we called their emergency line and never received a call back (we found another animal hospital- unfortunately our cat did not survive).

Then again, it might be the reminder we got in the mail 6 months later about his vaccinations. But when I think about it, I think the most frustrating part was speaking to their employee about the incident. They were very sorry about mailing the reminder. Completely missed the point...

I'm sure they are fine for basic services etc. and many people seem to be happy with them. But for me, the time I really needed them they were not helpful and it was completely mishandled. I get that our pet's death is not their fault per say, but I will never take my animals to them again.

name: Robyn E
text:
Unfortunately, I lost 2 pets in their care. I lost a Toy Poodle that I was told had pyometra and needed to be spayed immediately. I took her in and she was extremely sick. I went to visit her, and they had her in the boarding runs, surrounded by barking dogs. I asked for her to be moved to a more quiet place, so they moved her to the cat room. A couple of days later, I came to visit her again, and they had her in a "parvo" kennel that was being used for storage. She died shortly after that visit.

A couple of years later, I brought a Heeler in because she was throwing up. Same scenario--pyometra. They spayed her and her health continued to decline. After a few days, she was stable enough to come home. When my husband got there to pick her up, Dr Johnston said she "crashed" when he took her IV out. A couple of days later, the doctor recommended that we euthanize her.

I came in to pay my $1200 bill and pick up my dog's ashes,  and the doctor didn't even bother to talk to me. The young man at the desk apologized and hugged me. Then he handed me a stained pillowcase with a plastic bag full of ashes. I couldn't even get a list of procedures that they did on my Heeler.

It has taken me a long time to be able to write this review. Look around the clinic when you go in. There are used needles laying on counters and the place needs to be deep cleaned. The exam rooms are full of junk, so he uses the exam table in the middle, where the public has no business going.

I've been to a lot of vet clinics, and have worked at a couple. This one is sad.  Yes, Dr Johnston is nice, but that only goes so far.

resp.text:
Hi Robyn, first I would like to say we are so sorry for your loss. Since you have chosen to remain anonymous and this event occurred years ago, I have little recollection of the specific details. I do, however, remember you said you previously worked in vet clinics before. You were shown that my equipment is constantly upgraded and all approved treatment protocols were followed. You must still be grieving to write a scathing one star review so long after the event occurred. My heart goes out to you. I would have met you at the door with your ashes had I known you were here.
I am also very sorry that you did not have your dogs spayed. That would have prevented the deadly pyometra, not the lack of a "deep cleaning" which all but brand new clinics require. To ensure transparency, we do encourage clients to watch us work on their pets in our treatment area. All treatment areas have surgical instruments and needles in them. If a client does not care to watch, they always have the option to wait in the lobby. Since the time of your visit we have an entire new staff. I have shown them your review in an effort to reemphasize the importance of client communication, compassion, cleanliness, and grief management. Sometimes during upgrades to our facility, we regrettably must utilizes all the storage space including the exam room and isolation ward. Sounds like you caught us at a very busy time and we made some mistakes in those areas, but unfortunately those things could not have prevented the tragic outcome. All animals I see get the best care I can provide. Tragically, they do not all survive and I have as much trouble accepting that as you  do.
I have been practicing for 30 years now. Losing a patient gets hard every year. Online reviews are new to me. I take them all personally and would much rather speak in person. I am very accepting and open to constructive criticism.  As you can tell by the vast majority of my reviews, that my cherished clients are pleased. I know it is impossible to please everyone and save every pet, but I do try my hardest. It breaks my heart to know how you must feel to write this review after a loss so long ago. Again, I am sincerely sorry you are still grieving and I am hurting too.
My very best regards.

name: Matt Ezell
text:
My wife and I have been bringing our dogs here for years.  When we lived in Troy, we wrestled for years trying to find a vet we were truly comfortable with...  After being recommended here by friends, we have never looked again.  The people here not only do this for a 'job', but they do this because it is important to them and because they truly care for our animals...

Since, we have moved nearly 3 hours away from Troy, but still often drive our dogs back down for their shots and checkups when we can just because we love the care and value of the Pike Animal Hospital.

name: Theresa Frakes
text: Dr. Johnston is dedicated to his patients and treats each animal as if it were his own!

name: Jeff H (Tandom)
text: Just started taking my dog here after trying out a few of the other places. Johnson is a good vet who tells you like it is. He takes care your dog like one of his.

name: Amy Copeland
text: Wonderful place for your pets. Excellent care and compassion.

name: Vickie Roberts
text: Wonderful clinic to work with.

name: Ronda M
text: I have to give them a 5 star.  A friends baby boy Louie became very ill, due to being bit.  They weren't sure at first what had bitten him.  He didn't get any better with the treatment he was receiving so, they started an antivenom thinking that maybe he was bitten by a baby snake.  He has started to improve, but has a long road to recover.  Robin is extremely grateful for all that they are doing for Louie....  Thank you for all your care.

name: Rebecca Walters
text: The employees and doc says very friendly

name: Latasha Smith
text: Lost my dear Della but the vet and his staff was very compassionate towards my family thank you so much

name: Angel Tillery
text: Biggest, bestest heart! Such caring staff.

name: kevin heil
text:
I'm a truck driver who takes my dog everywhere i go.
Dr Johnson is a very good at what he does and will take care of your pet without unnecessary and expensive treatments.
I really thought the week of April 1st my dog got very sick on the road she wasn't looking good i thought i was going to lose her when we arrived back home.
She was treated and found out just bad allergies.
I can't thank him enough for what they do there at Pike Animal Hospital i have been there for as long as i can remember.
Agian THANK YOU ALL for all you did for my baby she is trucking again and healthy as a 10 year trucker can be.

name: Cathy Engwall
text: Great place, everyone is wonderful and will answer any questions that you might have !

name: tr3b0r85
text: They know me and my pets. If I bump into them away from the office they still inquire about how they are.

name: April Mooney
text: I will not ever take my animal to this vet ever again.  My regerstered service dog had been possessed and about dead.  We sat in their office for an hour and he had a accident in the waiting room they told us to get that thing outside and for us to find another vet.  Far worning people u may wanna find another vet to go to instead of this one. If you go to this one your little one may die.

name: Alice Jones
text: There great

name: Robin palisades
text: Saved my dogs life....

name: Ken Howe
text: Dr. Smith has performed four surgeries on my hands over the past two years. Two carpal tunnel surgeries, one to remove gout related deposits and one To repair a finger which I seriously injured in a saw mishap. Thanks to his skills and a very capable staff I have had fantastic results. I would highly recommend him to anyone in need of hand surgery. Thank you Dr Smith and your great staff!

name: Milton Smith
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are precise and meticulous with their diagnoses. He and the staff were courteous, and  kind in their attitudes toward me. His work has allowed me to be pain free with a very troubling problem.

name: K Brown
text:
I highly recommend Dr. Smith.  He took excellent care of my mother after she fell and required surgery.  He was very patient and kind and thorough with us and answered all our questions.
I went back to him for 2 elective hand surgeries and was very pleased with his care.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! Dr. Smith is definitely the best, and we'll pass along your feedback so he knows how great of a job he did. We'll always be ready to provide you with the highest level of service whenever you or your family require orthopaedic expertise.

name: Cindy Thompson
text: Dr. Smith was a wonderful doctor. He did surgery on my thumb and did a great job. I would recommend him if you need a good surgeon. He was very nice and sweet and he set down and talked to me and let me ask questions if I needed to. Just a great doctor. I would definitely go back to him.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Cindy! We're always happy to hear when we've accomplished our mission of providing 5-star care & service in our clinic.

name: Peggy Morris
text: Dr. Smith is a wonderful, caring doctor.  He diagnosed the issue with my hand, on first visit, and performed surgery. I’m pain-free and able to use it for the first time in months. The staff at Southlake Orthopedics has always been first rate and our family would go no where else for Ortho issues.

resp.text: So thrilled to hear about your experience, Peggy! And we're sure Dr. Smith and the rest of his staff will be excited to hear as well. We're lucky to have such a skilled and experienced surgeon as Dr. Smith as a part of the team.

name: Cindy Benson
text: Dr Smith did Carpal Tunnel Release surgery on my hand.  Excellent outcome.  Excellent surgeon and staff.  I highly recommend him.

name: Audrey Day
text: I am very pleased with the results of my carpal tunnel release surgery performed by doctor Smith. The whole process went smoothly from start to finish.

name: Keith Tolbert
text: I have the upmost confidence in Dr. Smith.  His background consists of prestigious schools and medical centers and he is very knowledgeable in this field. I also have great respect for Dr. Smith and and his staff.  I was very pleased with the results of my wrist after surgery and wouldn’t hesitate going back if I needed anything else.  A great man....a great doctor!!!!!!!  Thank you and God bless each one of you, Keith Tolbert

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Keith! We're so happy that you had a wonderful experience. We'll be sure to share this with Dr. Smith and the rest of the team so they know what a wonderful job they did.

name: Donna McCully
text: Great doctor as well as great staff. Wonderful surgical outcome...would highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Donna! Very happy to hear about your experience, and we'll be sure Dr. Smith and the team know what a great job they did.

name: cathy martin
text: Dr. Smith performed surgery on my hand/wrist to relieve pain.  He tried other options first, which I appreciated. I would highly recommend him for your Orthopaedic needs.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Cathy! We always aim to approach treatment with a surgery-last approach, but when the situation calls for it, we know we can trust the incredible expertise of Dr. Smith.

name: Tina Rinehart
text: Dr. Smith is a great doctor. He explains everything to you in a way that you understand what is going on. Him and his staff take every precaution to keep you safe as well. My mom can use her wrist/hand again now. He told her it would take 3 months after surgery and it took her 3 months just like he said. You could not ask for a better doctor and we highly recommend  him to anyone that needs an orthopedic  for their hand /wrist.  Also want to brag on their physical therapy department ladies Cathy and  Rebekah both are awesome and know their stuff.

name: Joey Lawhorn
text: A very good experience. Highly recommend Dr Smith and his entire staff.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Joey! We'll be sure to pass along your praises to the whole team. Thanks again for choosing us.

name: mickfinn4u
text:
Dr Smith ,PA and staff took great care of me and went beyond my expectations.I've been going to Southlake since 1987 and have always been well taken care of.
A+ Thanks

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Mick! Love to hear about a job well-done, but it's even better when we hear we have consistently done a great job!

name: Vicki Smith
text: There is no better surgeon than Dr. Smith.  As painful as the injury was, and the recovery physical therapy, the care was the best ever.  I've had other orthopedic surgeries in several different cities, but the professionalism of the staff is balanced with the genuine concern and care of the entire staff.  Love Dr. Smith, he's the best!

name: Otis Smith
text:
Dr. Smith reconstructed my finger after a table saw accident.  Would have never believed that the finger would have ever looked normal again, little lone functional.
His talent as a surgeon is far and above anything I have ever seen in my 60 years.
An honest, direct, extremely dedicated professional that I have highly recommend to everyone I meet in need of hand surgery.

name: Susan Hulsey
text: I stabbed my hand with a knife cutting an avocado.  Dr. Smith repaired the artery and the nerve in the palm of my hand.  I have regained strength in my hand and sensation in my fingers! I would recommend him to anyone for his knowledge, skill and expertise.  By the way, he is also nice!

name: DAVID V
text: This is the second time I used Dr. Smith for surgery - once on my wrist and once on my hand. He is an outstanding doctor from all aspects and expectations. Of all the 11 doctors that I currently using, he has the best technical skills and follow up after the surgery. Just as important, he has great people skills. He honestly cares about his patients and assures that the patient understands all options, all plans for treatment, and a clear path for recovery.  He is a very nice, caring and down to earth gentleman. I STRONGLY recommend Dr. Smith and the staff at Southlake Orthopaedics.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

name: Sheila Marcus
text: Best hand doctor I know

resp.text: Thanks for the high praise, Sheila! We appreciate you choosing our clinic, and we'll be ready to serve again should you or your family ever require orthopaedic services in the future.

name: Dianne Snow
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are absolutely fantastic in every aspect. They meet with you on a personal level making you feel comfortable and at ease. The day of my surgery was a never before experienced event; no sitting and waiting forever - I was taken back almost immediately after arriving, prepared for surgery, saw my husband, taken back and the next thing I knew I was waking up. If surgery could be an enjoyable experience, this one was. Follow up visits have been equally impressive. It’s a joy to deal with professionals of this caliber.

name: Margaret Harrill
text: I fell & broke my wrist at the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic. Dr. Smith "screwed" me back together with complete success! I was very impressed with the safety precautions practiced at both the outpatient surgery center & the Grandview office. My compliments not only to Dr. Smith for his care but for his team as well, Caroline his PA & Leslie PT. All couldn't have been kinder or more encouraging. In an emergency like mine you just take your chances with the surgeon available & willing to take you on.  With Dr. Smith I won the lottery!

name: Mary Belle Van Der Noord
text: Wonderful experience from beginning to end; I had been suffering from sharp joint pain in my left wrist and thumb that interfered with daily activities as well as my sleep. I am so grateful to Dr. Smith and his team of medical professionals for giving me my hand back!!

name: Sherri Magness
text: Dr. Smith and his entire staff have been wonderful to work with from the beginning consultation to the post op meetings!  Dr. Smith and his assistant, Caroline, are both very caring and knowledgeable. I could not have asked for a better team to take care of my hand (carpal tunnel).  They answered questions before I even knew I had them!  My surgery went well and recovery has been better than anticipated!  Thank you, Dr. Smith and Staff for helping me with this and getting me back to my new normal!

name: Stanley Woodall
text: Dr. Smith did an outstanding job with my carpal tunnel surgery and has great bedside manner.

name: Zada Edwards
text:
I'm very pleased with the kindness and support from the entire staff at Southlake Orthopaedic. Dr. Smith is absolutely fabulous!  He's one of the most understanding, kind and sensitive doctors you'll ever meet! Dr Smith will take the time to explain and listen to any concerns you may have.
Everything from my surgery to my follow up appointments have been superior. If you need to see a Orthopaedic Surgeon go see this guy! He's awesome!
Zada Edwards

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback.  Patient satisfaction is so important to my team at Southlake Orthopaedics!

name: Brenda Stevenson
text: Very pleased with my care and Dr Smith’s expertise.

name: Leslie Holliday
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are professional, kind and helpful. I have used their office for two surgeries and have been more than pleased with the care I received.

name: Kimberly Rudd
text: I am very pleased with the advise, recommendations and surgical work that Dr. Michael Smith and his staff provided. I was extremely surprised and happy to see that HE personally called to check on me the night of my surgery. Usually doctors don't do that themselves. If I need Orthopaedic Hand, shoulder or finger work again, I would go back to his office!

name: MOMMA WEBB
text: Love Dr Smit he always has a smile awesome as a surgeon did great on both of my surgery, I will recommend him to any one.  And he is not bad to look at LOL

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

text: I had a piece of metal under my fingernail and had to get it surgically removed. Dr. Smith and all the staff I dealt with were absolutely amazing. Dr. Smith even calls his patients the night of the surgery to check on you and make sure everything is going ok. He’s been a blessing!

text: Dr Smith really cares and listens to his patients and I feel his quality of services provided are excellent.

D. Burkes

The staff here have been exceptional and caring. I feel like they are on this journey with me and really wants me to succeed in my NEW life. I’m no longer surviving but LIVING. THANK YOU ALABAMA SURGICAL

I highly highly recommend this group. The level of care not only with the staff but also the hospital they chose was leaps and bounds better than any care I have received here at home in Indiana. If I had to do it all over again, I absolutely would.

So grateful to the BOTH of them for giving me this new tool to better my health and life.

name: Celina Lambeth
text: Dr. Doucette and his staff are amazing. I was always a priority when in the building. All of my questions were answered and they took their time with my appointments. My surgery went beautifully and my scars are perfect. Once healed, you wont be able to tell they are there. Dr. Doucette knows his stuff and fully explained the procedure, as well as his expectations for me. I am motivated to keep pushing forward, now that I have a clear defined goal before me, designed by my doctor. No complaints whatsoever.

name: Harold Turner
text: They really get to work at night clean place friendly staff really takes of their patience
