name: Greg Baxley
text: Although being a previous patient here my wife was told she had to have a doctor's referral to be seen again for a new injury which meant she had to wait to see a regular doctor so he could say she needs to see an orthopedic Dr asap. Paperwork was sent to this clinic on Thurs and when we called on Tuesday to see why we haven't gotten an appointment yet we were told "it hasn't been processed yet" now she has to wait almost a month for the "first available" appointment. And to top it off she was told she didn't need a referral after all! And this office can't call you if they have a cancellation, you have to call them daily if you want to have a chance to be seen faster

name: Karl GOULET
text: I had both my wrist done back to work in six weeks. He did a great job on me. My wife had Corporal tunnel to in her right hand a few years ago. She’s been great after he worked on her. No scar on my wife and mine are about gone

name: Carmie Carr
text:
Extremely rude front desk. I had a $25 copay. The appointment was for my husband. Since I had medicare and another supplemental I have never had to pay a copay.
I did not bring the correct credit card and the young girl at the desk said Dr. Ikard Jr would not see him unless we paid the $25 right then.
I told her I could call it in and she said I would need to reschedule if I did not have the $25 that day.
I feel any doctor who puts a value on a patient is not the kind if doctor I want to put my husbands care in.
If refusing a patient for $25 is our “new” new, then I’ll go somewhere else where my husband is worth more than $25 .
UOC is where money is far more important than a patients care.
They would have gotten their money if the front desk girl was more professional and would listen to me but we were blown off by her.
Thus my 1 star rating. If I could give a negative I would. Staff should show more understanding

name: Aaron Cano
text: Staff is not helpful and incompetent.... there is such a lack of communication and knowledge at the front desk. I was in Biloxi, Mississippi early that day. I called the office at 9:50am and asked if I get to the office 15 minutes late, could I still be seen. The receptionist said, “Yes, as long as it’s within 30 minutes of your scheduled appointment”. I knew that I can make my 3 hour and 50 minute drive in time to get there with 15 minutes to spare so I made the drive to Tuscaloosa. When I was 20 minutes from the office I called to ensure I can be seen and the same receptionist said no the doctor cannot see me. She completely contradicted her original statement and wasted a full 8 hours of driving and gas with no consideration to my particular situation. I will never recommend an office with an incompetent front desk staff and lack of care that I made a distant drive under unforeseen circumstances. If only they had the integrity to follow the original statement provided to me may I have had a totally different experience.

name: Teresa Atchenson
text: I WAS A PATIENT OF DR.JOHN P.BUCKLEY SINCE 1985.I LAST SAW THIS WONDERFUL MAN AND DOCTOR  IN FEB.OF 2017.THE NEXT FEB.I WAS TOLD HE RETIRED PREVIOUS DEC..I CRIED LIKE A BABY.HE WAS A DOCTOR THAT WAS CALM GOOD SPITIT,ALWAYS TOOK TIME TO ANSWER MY QUESTIONS.HE PASSED AWAY EARLY OF 2020.ONLY 2 YRS.OF RETIREMENT.IT BROKE MY HEART.LAST TIME I WAS AT UOC.WAS THE LAST TIME.I HAVENT SET A FOOT IN THERE SINCE DR.BUCKLEY PASSED.I TRIED TO GET AN APPT SINCE,BUT WAS TOLD SINCE MY DOCTOR RETIRED,I WOULD HAVE TO BE TREATED AS A NEW PATIENT.I TOLD THEM NO WAY.I WAS A PATIENT FROM 1985 - 2017.DR.BUCKLEY  ALL THOSE YEARS.THEY WANTED HIM OUT I WAS TOLD LAST TIME I WAS THERE NY A NURSE.THEY SAID HE TOOK UP TOO MUCH TIME WITH PATIENTS.HE WAS ONE OE DOCTORS THAT STARTED UOC IN 1974.THEY SHOULD BE ASHAMED.RIP DR.BUCKLEY.LOVE YOU❤.its true about rude staff too.

name: Latasha Hooper
text: Staff is very rude. I’ve called 6 times to schedule an appointment. Female that answers the phone catches an attitude very quickly.

name: Scott Shuttleworth
text: DO NOT USE THIS CLINIC!  Doctors may be good but the staff getting to them does not tell the truth and then cops attitude...I called a week before and specifically asked about them taking my insurance...they said yes the did...I specifically asked if they were network and they said yes...I made the appt and showed up after a 1.5 hour drive. Signed in, waited and they said they didn't have a referral from my doc...when they told me the week before they did...ok got that fixed...after waiting again they tell me they are in fact not in network for my insurance after I specifically asked that question prior to making the appt.  They told me I could be seen if I paid the amount for the visit but they wouldn't honor what they told me on the phone...after the clerk at the checkout window got cynical, I grabbed my imagery and stormed out for a 1.5 hour drive home only to find out that now I have to start over and find another doctor and live with this pain even longer...if possible and you have a choice, SEE ANOTHER CLINIC...DO NOT GO TO UNIVERSITY ORTHO!!!

name: Pamela Truelove-Walker
text: Dr. Thompson is a very thoughtful physician. He answers questions patiently, explains medical issues in practical terms, and offers multiple treatment options. He definitely listens to his patients and allows them input as it relates to surgical procedures. I HIGHLY recommend him for any Orthopaedic issues under his practice.

name: Alice Thomas
text: Dr Atkins Jr.  is great. Nice atmosphere. Wait time is very reasonable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Thank you for taking good care of me. Their physical therapy staff is wonderful.

name: Nancy Watkins
text: Dr. Ikard, Sr., did a full knee replacement for me 3 months ago.  A wonderful doctor who is very thorough and takes the time to listen to your concerns as well as answer any questions you may have about your surgery.  One of the most efficiently run offices I have been to - I don’t think I have ever waited more than 15 minutes to be called back.  Also the scheduler for the surgery was very nice and super efficient!  I had to have forms from my regular doctor and my cardiologist signed before the surgery could be scheduled.  She faxed those immediately and my surgery was scheduled for two weeks later.   All of the nurses, x ray technician and office staff could not have been nicer.   I would highly recommend the University Orthopaedic Clinic!

name: Leslie Alexander
text:
My son broke his hand and needed surgery. Dr. Claytor and his nurses were wonderful. Excellent bedside manner and helped this out of state mom feel better about surgery.
Scheduling and setting an appointment was a challenge because they were super busy in Monday. It was worth time I spent getting him scheduled because within 48 hours he was fixed up!

name: Pamela Richey
text: My appointment was at 8:00 o'clock. At 9:00 o'clock I went to the front desk to inquire if I would be seeing the doctor soon. I was told the doctor didn't come in until 9:00 o'clock and I was 4th in line to see him. Um..why schedule 8:00 o'clock appointments, if the doctor doesn't come in until 9:00 o'clock?

name: Rose Walker
text: The Doctors are the best.  The staff and nurse's are very friendly and helpful. I had knee surgery years ago and the doctor and nurse's took excellent care of me. Would recommend to my family and friends. Thank you UOC

name: Taylor Hollis
text: Dr Callahan was great. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Dr. Callahan got me in and out and knew his stuff! Looking forward to working with them in the future.

name: Kaitlyn Moore
text: Dr. Scott, outstanding workers comp experience.  Listens well. Sweat, friendly love him to death. Overall best doc visits I've ever had on anything.

name: Judy Craig
text: Dr.Scott and all the staff have been great at both of my appointments. I didn't feel like I was being rushed out. All around good experience. Would definitely recommend to others.

name: SPoKie DoKie
text: Amazing job. Not only is my affected area healing very well, they even took care to stitch my tattoo back together so there’s no damage. They have kept me informed every step of the way and I have never once been caught offguard with something. I couldn’t recommend them enough.

name: Sandra Dickie
text: Dr. Ikard Jr and UOC are very caring and professional! I could not ask for a better team of medical professionals. Everyone that greeted me from my arrival to my leaving were helpful, kind and encouraging.

name: Andrea Walker
text: My daughter had an knee injury. After being referred to Dr. Scott my daughter and I no idea what to expect. Visits before and after surgery were better than either of us could have imagined. Every step and any questions we had were explained to us with knowledge. Doctor and staff were amazing in both Tuscaloosa and Fayette locations.

name: TipTip *
text: My therapy went well, but I felt as if I needed more time. This was not a work injury, I paid for therapy myself. When I requested more therapy from them I was met with a negative attitude and response.

name: Sabrina West-Bullock
text: Dr.Ikard Sr. is the BEST! I've been under his care for a cyst on my foot. The care he gives, along with his bedside manners, are qualities any patient would dream of having.  He always makes me feel as if I'm being taken care of by a family member or close friend.  My experiences with him and the UOC were exceptional.

name: Charles Burton
text: I would have been a new patient except for the utter rudeness of the receptionist staff. The first young lady talked about me to her colleague as if I wasn't standing there and literally tossed the clipboard on the counter without saying a word. I shrugged my shoulders as to say, "what exactly are you asking me to do?" Her response and tone were totally dismissive and rude. Then, while trying to complete the forms, I was called back to the desk to be asked by the second young lady when I could reschedule. When I asked why I would need to reschedule, I was met with attitude and, again, a dismissive attitude. Admittedly, I was a few minutes late. However, as a potential new patient, I had no idea they had different locations at the time I scheduled the appointment. Therefore, my slight tardiness is attributed to that. I'm sure the actual medical staff is great. However, I can only imagine a loss of business due to the privileged and dismissive attitude of the staff you encounter when you walk thru the door. I will definitely be taking my business elsewhere.

name: Renee Adams
text: I received great care from a professional and caring staff. I’m no longer in debilitating pain after surgery, and so very grateful to Dr. Atkins and his staff.

name: Nell Taylor
text: Dr. Standerffer has been caring for my son and I for more than 10 years and every visit has been excellent. He is caring and patient and I’d recommend that anyone needing orthopedic care see him.

name: Jennifer Ward
text: The doctors a great! However, the front desk lady that sits to the left behind the two ladies in the immediate front at the Northport location is one of the RUDEST ladies I've ever encountered!! She makes  this office look BAD!

name: Barbara Allen
text: The lady who conducted the x-ray study was so kind, gentle, and caring. Dr. Buckley is truly a God send. I was majorly impressed with his wealth of knowledge and his ability to articulate so plainly what was going on with my shoulder. I left the clinic feeling like a million dollars and I have not had any left shoulder pain since treatment at the clinic. Thank you so much ‼️😀

name: Taura
text: Dr. McKibbon is awesome. I appreciate him taking the time to explain everything about my injury & the best treatments for healing. 👍

name: Danita Lightning
text: Very professional and courteous with an answer to every question asked that day! Service with a smile! Everyone seemed like a family!

name: Emmogene Edge
text: Its comforting to find medical services that match or exceed one's former services when one has moved to another state. I found the services at UOC in Tuscaloosa , to be wonderful. They are kind and patient. The staff and my new doctor have inspired my trust and given me confidence to go forward with the prescribed treatment my knees need. Thank you !

name: Mickey Dehaan
text: Dr. Standefer is the best surgeon.  He takes his time to explain things.  I also appreciate how he explains his " plan of care & course of actions".  Annex at Bryant Drive way too many chairs in such a small waiting room.  Every time a patient got up, I had to guard and repositioning my new total knee to avoid it getting smacked into.

name: Sherry Barr
text: Horrible. Made our appointment and gave insurance information in “advance”. They knew my son was in pain but would not see him without a referral from the university student center, even though we went to ER the night before. (But they did not tell us this before we showed up to the appointment) Made us fill out a book load of paperwork and then broke the news. Not concerned at all that this was their mistake, they didn’t even try to make any exception because he was in pain. Rude. Neverrrr again!

name: George Osborne
text: Excellent all the way around. Dr Thompson has operated on me 4 times. Each time my problem was corrected. Follow up visits were great. Very caring and helpful staff. I highly recommend University orthopedic clinic.

name: Betty Hancock
text: Dr. Ikard, Sr did my knee replacement in 2004. He was wonderful and a very precious person. He is such a gentle speaking doctor. He later did carpal tunnel surgery on my right hand and put a cortisone shot in my left hand for carpal tunnel. When my left hand began hurting severely again I called to see Dr. Ikard. I was told he only worked with knees. I was told i could see Dr Callahan for my hand. I saw him yesterday and he said i had end stage arthritis in my thumb joint. He put a shot in it. He was very serious. I wish he would please talk a little more and just have a more pleasant way. I get very nervous around a dr like him. Please Dr Callahan understand, i think you are a knowledgeable dr, but kindness sure helps alot. Dr John Newcomb in Nport Dch er is a very good example of a compassionate dr.

name: Denise
text: Dr. Tosh Atkins is by far the Best Ortho Doctor...He knows his stuff. ...He performed knee and shoulder surgery as of today I feel 120% better...If Dr. Atkins was near me right now...I'd give him a great big kiss...."Thank You and Kudos to a Job Well Done Dr Atkins"

name: Jill Carroll
text:
Everyone from the receptionist to the nurses, to the doctors are friendly knowledgeable and very professional. For joint pain and issues I would not go anywhere but to Dr. Atkins. I had a total knee replacement in my right knee over 20 years ago,  and have not had one minute’s trouble.  Truly appreciate
UOC and their staff.

name: Tyra Hoggle
text: Dr. Claytor is an amazing doctor and his staff is very professional.  Highly recommend!!

name: Amie Lemley
text: UOC has both great orthopedic physicians and ancillary staff! From the waiting room, to the X Ray techs, to check out, everyone was friendly and helpful!

name: April Soleil
text: That’s great if you’re well experienced and have a reason to come across somewhat arrogant (my uncle is an oncologist and he is a bit arrogant) however when you act like you’re better and in a hurry, have an attitude and say “I told her that I couldn’t aspirate” to the workers as soon as he’s coming back into the door, and bent out of shape because a patient asks questions, and overall a douche attitude- NO THANK YOU!!! Won’t be back. His presence made me feel inferior and less than and like I bothered him to keep him longer than a minute. I like friendly people, personally. If you would like to encounter a straight up a** then Dr Thompson at Northport DCH Medical Plaza (UOC) would be the one! Eek. Never again. I won’t be back to see him unless he wants to see a dose of his own medicine- no pun intended. Good luck boss man. The other staff were great (as why I left more stars than ONE) and I am only referencing Dr Thompson at UOC (Northport DCH medical plaza)

name: Q Crews
text: Dr. Ikard Jr. and the staff here are wonderful people. Kind and courteous, and always listen to your concerns. I will take my future injuries here above all others. Lol

name: Hanny Daddy
text: Friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. Parking can be a pain but that's not their fault.

name: James Mills Jr
text: Dr. Atkins and the staff at UOC are first class. Friendly, efficient, compassionate and talented. I would definately recommend them for your orthopedic needs.

name: Jerry Henson
text: I was extremely pleased with my visit with Dr. Atkins who is a very professional and friendly physician.  He spent a very adequate amount of time with me and answered all of my questions expertly and with clarity.  I would indeed recommend him to all of my family and friends.

name: Pecola Collins
text: Excellent care and the staff is very very nice and caring people. I would recommend UOC   To all of my friends and family!

name: Gunars Cazers
text: This place has it all together. The doctors and staff are comforted and friendly. I have used both the main office in the annex. My only gripe is that they cannot schedule an appointment six months in advance. Their computer program does not go that far in advance. They need to fix it.

name: Lynn Norris
text: University Orthopaedic has been great to meet the needs of my husband and me this year. We have used the physicians offices, MRI, and the therapy staff and  facilities. We highly recommend them to anyone needing Orthopaedic services.

name: Bonnie Buck
text: Dr. Standeffer does a great job explaining situations and concerns. He is kind with helpful advice, especially regarding my health as an older patient and medicines. My shoulder surgery went very well. His encouraging personality helps me to try harder. When you are in pain that can be tough. Excellent doctor and staff.

name: John Perry
text: All I can say is excellent from entry to exit. Kind and effecient office staff. Kind, efficient and competent medical professionals with the procedure.

name: Judith Ingram
text: This was my first experience with Dr. Scott and his office and I was extremely pleased with the service I received. From check-in to check-out the entire staff was friendly and concerned about the patient.

name: Pat Gregg
text: My family has used UOC for many years.  From knee replacements, shoulder surgery, knee scopes etc., we have always been pleased with the caring staff and excellent doctors.  We have a special affinity for Dr. Atkins as he literally put my brother back together after a horrific motorcyle accident.

name: Mary Peacock
text: Dr. Scott and staff were very professional and had excellent bedside manor. They do an awesome job explaining to us the process and answering any questions we had.

name: Teresa Jackson
text: The BEST doctors in Tuscaloosa hands down and I Love the staff so much because they’re the SWEETEST EVER ❤️

name: Jane Richardson
text: The physicians & staff are wonderful; the wait time are acceptable. The quality of patient care is simply outstanding!

name: Emily DeFrance
text:
This post is to make others aware of UOC's internal accounting issues. I personally experienced this situation below on 10/08/2018. If you get a bill from them, double check everything. They are trying to make patients responsible for their own adjustment errors back in 2014. They just caught these errors they made in 2018 because they waited 4 years to audit their books. That being said.......my story below.

UOC is a good organization and has always done a great job whenever I have visited their office. However, I recently received a bill out of the blue saying I owed over $300.00. First and foremost, I pay my bills on time and do not let my accounts become delinquent. I called their office to find out why I received a letter saying I owed money since I was recently just in their office and they never mentioned this balance before. I found out they recently did an audit on September 28th, 2018 and realized they made an internal accounting error from 4 years ago. So when my account was adjusted back from THEIR mistakes, my account showed an open balance and they sent me a bill demanding payment.

Long story short - Their company made an internal accounting error and they just caught this 4 years later and are now trying to back charge their patients for their OWN mistakes in their accounting department. I went down to their office and they were not willing to work things out with me based off of their own negligence in their bookkeeping department. Not until I told them that my attorney and I were going to sue them and I was going to bring in Fox 6 News on your side (to expose their company with what they were doing behind the scenes to their patients) did they try to eliminate my bill from where they made a mistake (now my patient balance is zero - how convenient). I have never heard of any type of business back charging someone for THEIR own mistakes. It's called have a check and balance system in place, perform a yearly audit on your books and train your office staff to do their jobs correctly.

name: Paul Arnold
text: I have been going to UOC for over 10 years and just had a total knee replacement. I was back at work in 6 weeks due to their great Physical Therapy. Dr. Standeffer has always spent extra time explaining things to me and the staff is always friendly.

name: Tracie Barnett
text: My daugther had an appointment to at 8:30 with Dr. Standefer for a cyst that has ruptured. It is painful & swollen! When she got there they took her copay then told her they couldn't see her because her appointment was at 8:00. My daugther told the receptionist that she received a text reminder yesterday that said 8:00. So the receptionist said the text was wrong & she would have to reschedule. Ok that automatic text system belong to them so that was the Dr office fault so I feel like they should have seen her. So I called & talked to the unconcerned receptionist trying to explain to her that my daughter really need to see the Dr today because it was not her fault. She said you want to reschedule because those are Dr. Standefer rules. He told them to tell me to tell her to put a brace on it. She been wearing the brace every since it ruptured. My daughter got to wait another week to see the Dr & be in pain. I just want you all to know God sit high & looks low. You all did my daughter wrong today but you don't have to worry about doing her wrong again. I pray nobody ever do your daughter or son the way you did my daughter today! WHAT GOES AROUND COMES AROUND!!!!  It's so hard as a parent to heard your child crying because they are tired of hurting & there's nothing you can do. Thank God for a Dr & receptionist that was concerned about my daugther hand. She has an appointment...Thank God for favor!!!!

name: Richard Rand
text: Great doctors, great specialists, great nurses, great secretaries.  A truly exceptional team, working together with great efficiency and consideration for the patient.

name: May Hicks
text: Dr. Standefer is a wonderful doctor and has done an outstanding job on multiple injuries I acquired in a car accident. I would highly recommend him or any of his assistants to anyone with any bone or joint injuries. Thank you again Doctor for your superior work and wonderful attitude as well.

name: Jackie Fochtmann
text: Great office staff and Dr. Standeffer is the best.  I have always had a pleasant experience here.

name: Leslie Draper
text: Super friendly staff.  Doctor was very thorough, compassionate, and accommodating. Highly recommended.

name: Twanda White
text: Friendly staff and Dr. Thompson was very nice and precise.

name: Sherry Ellis
text: Pleasant atmosphere. Excellent service from nurse and doctor. Receptionist friendly and provided great service with check in.

name: Rheonna Wiuff
text:
I came to Dr. McKibbin for a second opinion regarding surgery for an ankle injury. I was pleasantly surprised.  His office nurse was very kind, thorough and professional. Took her time taking careful notes and history. Dr. McKibbin was very thoughtful in his questions, physical exam, and spent time reviewing my history,  MRI, Xrays, and Dr.'s notes. He took time more going over my case than I expected. In the end he gave a me his opinions and assessment regarding my injury and treatment.
UPDATE! After seeing Dr. MCKIBBIN for months, him collecting payments for seeing me and telling me one thing about my injury and long term prognosis. He SOLD OUT to the Workmen’s Comp Insurance that pays him and F-ed me out of a fair Work Comp Claim. My injury, as he agreed, I will suffer with the rest of my life and have to make major lifestyle changes to live with. However, he gave Work Comp a different story and assessed me at 0.
Choose your Dr’s carefully, especially if you have a work related injury! If I had known, I would have asked him at the first visit about his rating history and who he felt his loyalty goes to?
If you have a Work Comp case
DO
NOT
CHOOSE
DR.
MCKIBBIN!!!!!!!
He’s a sale out for the insurance check. As long as he gives them low grade assessments and they don’t have to pay out money to the injured parties he stays on their payroll and they send him more patients and it all starts over again.

name: Patricia Pritchett
text: Very efficient and and very comfortable with the staff and Dr Atkins going again as soon as time allows

name: Kristen Watkins
text: I had my knee surgery here several years ago and was very pleased.  My ENTIRE family uses UOC when we need an orthopedic specialist.  One family member in particular uses them for cortisone injections every few months.  The same family member had an accident over the Christmas holiday and needed to be seen after being seen in the E.R. She called to schedule an appointment and was told that it will be Monday Jan. 4TH before they can get her in unless there is a break or fracture.  So she had to go to her primary doctor after the E.R.(pay another 35.00 copay after the 150.00 E.R. copay) to have him order more x-rays.  I called to see if there was any way to get her in trying to explain the situation that she couldn't wait another 6 days even if it wasn't broke or fractured (she can't put any weight on it and its about the size of a softball)  when she originally injured her foot on Dec. 23rd and the receptionist said there was nothing she could do so I ask to speak to the office manager.  I was transferred to Jennifer Germain.  I have never in my life had someone yell at me like she did.  I was a firm believer in UOC until now.  I bet if the physicians knew this is how their practice was being ran they would probably make several staff changes starting with Ms. Germain.  I know that every place of business has rules and I have worked with the public for several years, so I truly get it.  But to yell at someone..... WOW! I don't care if I broke every bone in my body. I'll never be back.( if it was around a holiday it wouldn't matter... they wouldn't be able to fit me in anyways!)

name: Rose Boyd
text: My Dr. was great; his staff not so much. They were not very friendly, could be condescending, but when you get through the surgery and first few office visits - I highly recommend UOC PT!  This is why I rate 5 stars..The staff is exceptional and very friendly. I never once dreaded going to PT. I had rotator cuff surgery and during my therapy sessions Will and/or Stephen would tell me exactly what they were doing and why they were doing it. They were supportive and encouraging.  I felt like a part of the UOC PT family on my first visit.

name: Kenneth Tingle
text: Every time I visit UOC I’m there 2 to 3 hours and thats ridiculous.   Just for a shot.  The doctors are good but the wait time is horrible

name: Jennifer Mack
text: Friendly staff, pleasant atmosphere and no time wasted.

name: A snarling Fetus
text: I had a terrible experience here. They deleted my last review off of this page, because I was not at all satisfied with the "treatment" I received here. I was made fun of by the staff for wanting to put my broken tibia in a hard cast. When they finally took it off they xrayed my leg again and it was still broken. At this point the doctor told me I was fine, and I should immediatly start walking on it. This was definitly not the case, and I am expecting to have surgery now 6 months later to fix the 2 completly disalligned tendons these idiots failed to even recognize. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME with these people.

name: Kimberly Grammer
text: As always Dr. Standerfer and staff was caring and professiona! I called 1 day and was given an appointment within days.

name: Heather Spires
text: A bunch of sweet staff !! Had me in and out in no time !

name: Brett Grady
text: I had both knees worked on, separately. By Dr.Claytor. he is really good. He will do a great job, and you will get the proper pre and post op treatments, and meetings. You will be glad if you choose him. I had repair of the meniscus due to tears. I am now doing a lot better. I am glad I got the surgery done. I have never waited to long for an appointment. The Dr. Is top notch...i can say because of how I feel after the procedures. The staff at the Tuscaloosa clinic, and the Northport clinic are always friendly, kind, professional, and always smiling. Appropriately smiling...no fakers here! They want you to feel good, and I always did, and still do. These people know what proper bedside manner is, and I thank them for it. The surgical center at Northport is equally kind, curtious, professional, caring...if it sounds like I am pitching for them...no, I am telling you that if you need this type of help/care...UOC...that is where you find it.

name: Brenda Hayworth
text: Would definitely recommend Dr Scott.  Excellent experience.

name: Sharon Ohara
text: Their professionals coming in and going out with care and understanding. Thanks UOC

name: Debra corley
text: Dr Clayter , is a wonderful Dr, best Pearson I have seen and the does great work , and the OUC physical therapy, group is wonderful also , John is great and the staff is very curtiuse , thanks Ouc Doctors and Physical Therpy

name: Joey Foster
text: Friendly staff with a professional customer centric environment.

name: Wanda Boothe
text: Extremely caring and friendly staff and Doctors.

name: Jerri McCreless
text: Great service , nurses.,and doctors!  Receptionists are very helpful!

name: angela rose
text: The staff and Dr. Thompson are awesome I love UOC!!!!!

name: Paulette Garner
text: Friendly and caring. Great experience.

name: charlie turner
text: been using  U.O.C. for a longtime   never think about going anywhere else

name: Ryan Karamichael
text: Started out all nice and dandy.

name: Adam Beams
text: Great service and care!

name: Cindy Redick
text: Excellent Doctor and Staff

name: Dana Gilliam
text: Was disappointed with the waiting situation. I was there with my brother at the Northport location. The waiting room was so full my brother, who was on crutches from surgery and had a blood clot, had to stand in the hallway and wait for a place to sit  causing horrible swelling. Unacceptable.

name: Jessica Simmons
text: Amazing place!

name: Aswesome Friends
text: Great group of doctors!

name: Lance G
text: Very impressed with my visit. Doctor and staff were very knowledgeable and professional. Will be back!

name: Anna Moses
text: Very happy and impressed with my doctor and the staff.

name: Warren Crow
text: It had been some time between visits to an optometrist and my more regular ophthalmologists. I found the three assistants and one optometrist to be empathetic to my situation which I think is rare. I was treated well and taken care of by all. I think the eye exam series was the most comprehensive I have ever had. Being in my 60s I had conversations which included discussions of multifocal contact lenses and cataracts plus premium IOL choices. I loved the visit and will continue with this group. I am lined up for a multifocal contact lens fitting (why can't I be without glasses) and know I need an eyeglass pair with new prescription to back up contact lens use.

name: ST FU
text: My (now former) eye doctor requested unnecessary tests. It took months and several unreturned messages to get someone to answer my questions. The office staff and manager were not helpful and lacked urgency in returning my calls. When my call was finally returned the manager was not helpful nor cheerful. They did not care to listen to me as a patient and because of all these issues I do not recommend.

resp.text: Hello, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about these tests and the difficulty you had reaching us, as well as the treatment by our staff -- this is definitely not the experience we want for our patients! I'd like to learn more about what happened. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: lexi ivan
text: I was sent back within 10 minutes of my appointment time. The assistant was very efficient with the preliminary testing. Dr. Hines was very kind and informative. When I told her I wanted monthly contacts instead of dailies, she understood and didn't try to force dailies on me like many doctors. The rep in the frames room went above and beyond to help me pick out frames I was happy with. My first pair came two days after my appointment, and my second pair will be in within 2 weeks. I was very happy with my visit!

name: Erika McDonald
text: Everyone who works here is wonderful but Dr. Schwertz is really above and beyond fabulous! She listens and takes her time to address all concerns you may have and she truly advocates for her patients and what is in their best interest. She provides wonderful care and I highly recommend her.

name: Cindy Bynum
text: I highly recommend these guys! They are so great, efficient, and friendly. I see Dr. White, and she's phenomenal. She ensures to carefully explain everything and address any and every issue I have. You can tell they take great pride in their work and are very thorough. 5+ stars for these guys.

name: Jody Wilson
text: I experienced a long wait time when I went in last week. The Doctor is great. I think if your appointment is at 9:20, you should be seen within 20 minutes. I will admit the I am impatient. All of my other appointments at other establishments see me within 5 minutes.  What’s the point in having a appointment, if you can’t be seen around that time.

name: Jameisha Large
text: Excellent staff and service. I loved the atmosphere it was pleasant and welcoming. I really liked Dr. White he made me feel valued and my exam was informative and comfortable. I did not meet one rude person and neither was I left unattended when I was shopping for eyewear. So heck yeah I will be referring people to this location. Five Stars is what you deserve!

name: Lem Motlow
text: Will be changing offices due to the very poor time management and lack of respect for patients time. Every year i have been going for the past four i have had to wait for at least an hour for Dr. Hines. she is very good and pleasant , however either her or the office scheduling is not good. this is not a COVID issue. this has been each year. I work less than 1/4 mile from this location and with at least 4 other office co workers who use her and  like her but not her time management and lack of respect for patients time as many of us come on our lunch break. i understand emergency come up and may have to wait longer than usual due to unseen circumstances once in awhile but when its every year and joked about at office with co workers who use location office and Dr. then it is not us its YOU

resp.text: Lem, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about the delays you've experienced visiting our office. I'd like to look into why this is happening -- could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: Larry Futrell
text: Staff very friendly and professional. Dr. Hang is friendly, professional and very thorough with her exams. I always look forward to my appointments because the atmosphere there is delightful and very amiable!

name: Forrest Plummer
text: My first visit to the Hoover location. I was more than impressed with the professionalism by each associate from the front counter all the way around. Kara took care of all the preliminary tests and was beneficial in making me comfortable as I felt I was bombing several eye tests. Dr. Amos was very helpful explaining everything as she went along. I am looking forward to many years to come.

name: April Taylor
text: The entire staff was amazing when we had our first visit there a couple of weeks ago. My daughter and I were made very comfortable and the exam was very thorough. Dr. Hang is wonderful and easy to talk to. We will be coming back here and also bringing the hubby and my other daughter!

name: Fredia Dillard
text: Great place! Love Dr. Amos. I've been with her for 10 years now. She understands my issues and truly listens. She does not rush through an exam and will offer options.

name: Dawn Kirkland
text: Rob Pate and his staff are wonderful.  I always feel like they are so glad to see me and I have a deep level of confidence in the care I am receiving.  I have recommended Dr. Pate to everyone I have talked to who needs a great eye doctor--in fact, my husband is there this morning!

name: Teala McDowell
text: I had a wonderful experience at EyeCare Associates in Hoover! Dr. Amos definitely ranks at the top of the list not only for her physician skills, but also for her amazing care and concern for her patients, personally. I have been recommending her to all of my Alabama friends! If you are reading this review as you look for someone to take wonderful care of your eye needs, look no more...you found her!

name: Michelle Riley
text: From the time you enter the front door until you leave, you will experience excellent customer service. I recently move to Northern Alabama and I have no plans whatsoever to change eye doctors. I will gladly do the long drive.  They have modern equipment, clean and attractive office space and knowledgeable team members.  I'm sure all the doctors are great but I'm on Team Amos!

name: Derrick Mendez
text: As a patient of Dr. Hammond's for over 10 years, I continue recommend her to anyone I encounter who's in search of an eye care professional.  She is always willing to take the extra step to make sure her patients (which include several members of my family) are taken care of.

name: Marilyn Martin
text: I've been with Dr. Amos for about 38 years and always want her to check out my eyes.  She is very professional but also very friendly.  I recommend her to anyone who needs a wonderful eye doctor.

name: Suzanne Eberhardt
text: My children and I are all patients of Dr. Pate's. It has been a positive experience every time we have been to the office, even when we have walked in without an appointment to get my son's glasses fixed. I have also recommended him to several people and would not hesitate to do it again.

name: Latisha A
text: Today was my first visit and I was very impressed with the entire staff especially Dr. Pate.

name: S B
text: Apparently they changed owners and most of the staff has left.  Dr. Amos was fantastic  as usual but the 2 hour appointment, LONG wait, disorganization and terrible service from everybody else will have me looking elsewhere for my next checkup.

name: Brendolyn Terry
text: I miss dr.pate, but dr. Ansley is good too

name: Christian S
text: They miss represented the quality of the frames they sold me. The metal in the frames fatigued after 6 months and I had to replace them at full cost. This isn't why they get the 1 star. The 1 star is for the poor customer service. I will not return and do not recommend them for purchasing frames/Eyewear.

name: ChaLestar Hill
text: This office is absolutely AWFUL!!! Poor customer service and it takes so long to get your order back. I waited an entire month to hear from them and I have yet to pick up my glasses from them.

name: Aljona Black
text:
Dr William Kettunen is an amazing doctor and a truly compassionate individual who cares for his patients. When my mom was diagnosed with terminal cancer, he went above and beyond walking with us through the entire process, even though it wasn’t his field of work or specialty. I can’t thank him enough for his help and kindness!
He was our light during the darkest time of our life. He also operated on my husband several years ago and he delivered outstanding medical service. He is smart, knowledgeable, always on point, and genuinely caring.

name: MARIA PEREZ
text: GREAT SURGEON! WONDERFUL STAFF. IF YOU NEED A SURGEON, LOOK NO FURTHER ; PROFESSIONAL AND CARING TEAM. AWESOME BEDSIDE MANNER AND A DOCTOR WHO ACTUALLY LISTENS !! THANK YOU , THANK YOU.

name: Ed Corley
text: Great Doctor and staff. Doctor Kettunen is not only a super surgeon but also very compassionate. His communication skills and concern make tough days for his patients a lot easier to handle. His willingness to make that  extra trip to your room or answer one more question sets him apart. I highly recommend him.

name: shrpshooter684
text: Dr. Kettunen is friendly, professional and has a great staff.  His office is very clean and orderly.  I was referred to him to have my first colonoscopy.  The procedure was explained in advance and totally painless. Afterwards, I was presented with photos and detailed briefing of what was found.  Finally, Dr. Kettunen thanked me for letting him take care of me.  What doctor does that?!? Dr. Kettunen did. The whole process could not have been better, thanks to Dr. Kettunen.

name: Margaret Esplin
text: I was referred here and they were wonderful. The lady at the front desk was prompt and very sweet. And the Dr. was great and making me not feel crazy and stressed about why I was there. Overall the office had a nice personal small feel to it.

name: Marshall Godber
text: Very friendly Doctor and staff. Cares about his patients and makes sure they are comfortable every step of the way. Highly recommend!

name: Derrick Rainwater
text: I’ve had a lot of major surgeries from a lot of different doctors. Dr William Kettunen is the first doctor whom walked me through the entire surgery from the consult, preop, recovery, and he personally called me afterwards to see how I am.  He is sincere and a true professional!  Instead of a group of staff, he took care of me personally every step of the way.  I’d absolutely suggest this doctor to anyone who is nervous about surgery.

name: Alan Sammons
text: Friendly sercivice from all the staff, very nice and comfortable facilities, and Dr Kettunen is a doctor who listens to you, takes great care to examine you well, and ensure you understand best courses of action for you to decide what's best for your care.

name: K-Diva Licious
text: I absolutely love the staff they were all nice and friendly. The doctor is by far the best eye doctor that I have had. She is very thorough and informative. I always enjoy my appointment when I go there it's like seeing old friends.

name: Susan Johnson
text: My grandson’s glasses were broken so we went here to have them replaced or repaired. Gene was able to do a quick, temporary fix; also, gave us a coupon to use to purchase new glasses. We are always pleased when we go here. Dr. Vanoy always takes good care of my family! I highly recommend this location!

name: Tara Orie
text: Rip-off, you can get higher quality services at much cheaper prices out there. In short, my contact prescription was incorrect and my glasses prescription was incorrect; both of which resulted in my glasses being unusable as well as half of the contacts I purchased. In total I paid over $800 for all services and glasses/contacts. And now over a year later, I'm receiving calls from a debt collector claiming that I still owe another $100. Go somewhere else.

resp.text: Tara, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about your experience in our office! I'd like to look into what happened. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: jirah mccall
text: I love this place and the staff! Everyone is very friendly and helpful. I’ve never had a bad experience.

name: shirley jones
text: This is a very clean and professional environment! Dr. Karen is very patience and knowledgeable! She took her time with Sarah whom is disable.I highly recommend her services!

name: Lashaunda Barganier
text: The experience I had was very wonderful. The people there were very nice

name: Christinay Bogan
text: EVERYONE was really nice and verryyyy professional! My sister spoke volumes of you and this is why I chose to come. I am glad I did. I will be bringing my 8 year old daughter next.

name: Lorenzo Jones
text: I look forward to my yearly visit with the doctor and the staff are very pleasant

name: Christopher Cambron
text: It’s funny how I ended up with my appointment. They sent a text to someone else to verify their appointment. I said , they had the wrong number but I needed an appointment. So they set me one. I have never found a sweeter more knowledgeable staff. Looking forward to getting my new glasses. Thanks again girls for a job very well done.

name: Vanessa Cartet
text: Thanks So Very much for An Awesome Experience!

name: Paulette Boston
text:
I had an appointment with eyecare associates about  a month ago.
the optometrist that did my eye exam was very good I was very pleased.
the night mare began once I sat at the desk to choose my glasses.
the associate reviewed the order due to the fact that she was the expert on eyewear. I ended up with additional  things I did not really need on my
glasses. I got them home and could not see my work computer, everything was blurry even reading. I called and informed them that
the glasses was not working,, the optometrist rechecked my eyes and
the prescription it was good. I informed them it was the coating on the
glasses all that extra that had been added. they did an minor adjustment
I still could not see my computer it was still blurry. I  went back a third time and insisted that they remove all those coating-Ultimate Poly-Carb
Addon*Ultimate Poly*Anti-Reflective Premium*UV400, This was close to
ridiculous that I had to spend time running back and forth for a pair of
new glasses that I could not use. After those coatings were removed
I can see my work computer better but they are not better than my old
glasses. I was so frustrated and disappointed  not only to have to go back today to have the associate to remove the black pen mark they left on my
glasses when they were trying to make the corrections. I have never had this much trouble getting a new pair of glasses. This was not the type
of service that I was expecting, It was as if they could not seem to get
my glasses right.

resp.text: Paulette, I'm Cassie. I'm glad you enjoyed the optometrist at your visit, and I'm so sorry about all these issues with your glasses! I'd like to look into how this happened. When you have a moment, could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: Kat Smith
text: No matter how long it's been, I feel like I'm visiting my family when I come there. Everyone is welcoming, warm, and genuinely glad to see me. I always leave with a smile! Their customer service is AMAZING!

name: audraruth
text: Very nice and professional.

name: Cindy Knox
text: I just appreciate how friendly everyone was. I felt like everyone genuinely cared about me as a person! Thanks for the excellent care!

name: Dawn Wilson
text:
I Love My EyeCare Family❤️
The Awesome Group has never let me down!

name: Nicholas Klein
text: Fantastic experience! I spent a few weeks in Birmingham on business and had experienced some eyesight issues in between my regular eye care checkups. I had a appointment scheduled very quickly and was treated with much care and respect. Everyone on phone and in person were very inviting and helpful and I highly recommend this location for your next eye care visit!

name: Teresa Henry
text: Staff very friendly and professional,Dr always kind and informative feel I'm in good hands with Dr Vanoy

name: oshields07
text: The service & staff is always amazing. Well informative & kind.

name: Homemade with Marsha
text: Everyone was very sweet !  And very helpful.

name: Latricia Faith
text: This was my first time visiting EyeCare Associates, Dr. Vanoy and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Dr. Vanoy thoroughly explained all information pertaining to my eye exam. I am happy that I chose EyeCare Associates for my eye care services.

name: Taylor Campbell
text: Very, very pleased with my first appointment here. The front desk and staff were wonderful! Very helpful and personable. Dr. Vanoy took the time to explain, in detail, something specific about my eyesight that I have never been told before; and I was amazed. After fitting me for the perfect contacts for my needs, I am blown away with the difference. I would highly recommend this office to anyone who asks.

name: Heels & Hardhats
text: Thanks for being so friendly, especially, since I had just buried my dad the day before. I needed the uplift. You guys are amazing and the service was out of this world. Again, Thanks!

resp.text: Ton, I'm so sorry to hear about your dad! Thank you for taking the time to write a review -- I'm so glad we could offer a little comfort. We're very glad to have you as a patient!

name: LP Key
text: Dr. Vanoy is knowledgeable and easy to talk to. The office staff is great as well. I have had great experiences with this office year over year.

name: Lacie Travis
text: The woman who did my exam was wonderful. I do wish there were more frame options. I had a hard time finding a pair I liked. I then had to ask multiple times for my prescription and PD to attempt to look for a pair online. They refused to give a PD unless I bought from them. I was under the impression that it was a part of the exam I paid for. I would've paid a fee for the convenience had that been an option. I ended up going across the street to another chain and they gave me those measurements for free. I was so happy with their service and frame options that I didn't even end up buying online, I bought 2 pairs from them. That little extra courtesy could've been a sale for them. I likely won't go back due to those circumstances. Again, the actual optician was wonderful. They just need more selection and they wouldn't have to worry about losing sales to other chains and online vendors.

name: Izz Noland
text: Thank you to Dr. Karen Vanoy for being thorough and explaining everything very well for my first eye exam. Thank you Carson for going above and beyond and sending me the retina scans, and thank you so much Janice for the process of choosing frames and lenses, getting me the best deals around!

name: ANew Friend
text: I always enjoy visiting the Eye Care Associates, Wildwood location. I appreciate all of the staff. Dr. Vanoy, Janice, Thomasina, and everyone else is always so nice.

name: Lindsey Waldrop
text: Wonderful experience, delightful staff and Dr!!

name: Tikesha Monique
text: Dr. Venoy and the entire staff were amazing.

name: media 411 news and interviews
text: Great experience great staff and awesome doctor

name: JENISE WALKER
text: Absolutely love th Dr, the office and the staff!

name: schadell lewis
text: Great staff and Great atmosphere!!! Everyone was very nice and made my first but not last visit feel like home. Thank you Eye Care Associates for taking out the time to explain everything that I wasn’t sure of.

name: africka overton
text: I love the Eye Care Associate. They are very loving and caring and personal. My children and I have been going there for about 15 yrs. And now my fiance is seen their now. Love you all don't change a thing

name: Jeffrey Marks
text: The staff is friendly the doctor who is on call is absolutely GREAT!!! I mean fantastic!!! The service is great the people are great. I can honestly say this is where I'll be coming from now on :) five thumbs up

name: Dennis Sheffield
text:
Did a great job!   Dr. Vanoy spend alot if time explaining things to me.  Can not think of anything I would change!
BTW, whomever rated this as one star must have meant to review the store two doors down, Dirt Cheap.

name: Lauren Bowerman
text: Great experience overall! The front desk workers were attentive, kind, and helpful, the man who assisted me in the first exam room was wonderful, and Dr. Karen Vanoy was thorough in her exam, answered all my questions, and even sent me a handwritten thank you card after my appointment. Would highly recommend for quality of care and service!

name: Larry Spencer
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. I am 35 years old and showed up with my mom for support. Lol! I have always been afraid to get my eyes examined; however, everyone was very professional and understanding. Dr. Vanoy explained everything to me and treated me like I was her child. She calmed my spirit. Everything was perfect! Thank you for going above and beyond to make me feel at ease.
The staff even helped me find a pair of glasses to fit me. - Regina Spencer

name: Hai2u Official (Slim)
text: My son had a great experience here, it was his first exam at an eye care place. Very friendly and helpful staff. Doctor was very helpful so was the male assistant. Very quick service!

name: Patricia McDonald
text: Staff is courteous and pleasant to deal with. Dr Vanoy is very knowledgeable and explains everything and answers any questions.

name: Angela Cox
text: They made my daughter very comfortable and at ease with the process of the exams. Dr. Vanoy is very knowledgeable and committed to better eye health of her patients. The staff is very helpful and professional!

name: Jessyca McKnight
text: 9 out of 10. My eyes are still out of focus and seeing starbursts at night from being dialated 2 days ago :-(

name: Sarah Glanding
text: I would recommend coming here the staff was really nice. Everything was clean and I did not mind getting my eyes checked this time

name: Tony Thompson
text: The provider...was excellent and the staff was very courteous too me...

name: nna Coleman
text: They are very, kind and professional people.

name: Devon Stafford
text: Pretty Good Place, Always In & Out. Staff Is Very Friendly & Professional. Only Thing Is I Wish They Would Have A Larger Slection Of Frames For Customers To Select From But Other Than That Great Place!

name: Ellen W
text: Friendly and thorough. Will definitely be going back here when I need a new contact prescription.

name: Charles Diggins
text: They kept calling me begging me to come in for an appointment. I go in for an appointment only to find out that their equipment is not working. I missed work for nothing. NEVER AGAIN FOR ME. PLEASE RUN FOR YOUR LIFE

name: Alex Prowell
text: Greaat customer service and very knowledgeable of all there products

name: Ace Queens
text:
Awful place long wait for my appointment. Never received my contacts. When I called to ask about them why I hadn’t received my contacts I was told they were too busy for me twice. So I had to go get in their face at the store. Made them give me a refund.
Don’t go there!!!

name: Meg Saxon
text: I have been a patient at EyeCare Associates in Wildwood for about 2 years. I enjoy going there for a yearly checkup because the appointments are easy to make and are quick. I also LOVE Dr. McStoots - she is so friendly and does a wonderful job. I can tell that she takes her time with each patient because she is totally focused on me. I have also had great experiences ordering contacts each year through their office. I definitely recommend going here, especially if you live or work close to the Homewood area - it's so convenient!

name: Bill Farris
text: Dr. Lavigne & staff are most friendly, helpful & meet all of my Eyecare needs

name: Mary Reid
text: Dr. McStoots was genuinely concerned and caring-explained in detail concerns without rushing.Her staff was also kind and professional.

name: Peggy Little
text: Highly recommend!! Excellent staff!

name: Rosalynn Jones
text: Awesome staff...very friendly atmosphere!

name: hiram hightower
text: Everyone did an awesome job very satisfied

name: Nakiki Speer
text: Very friendly staff.  Glad that I chose EyeCare Associates to take care of my eye health.

name: Jason Hall
text: Wonderful care from experienced staff!

name: Michael Moore
text: Great

text: Kind and helpful

Dr. Karen Vanoy is the absolute BEST!!!

text:
(Translated by Google) Dr. Vanoy is the best !!

Dr. Vanoy is the best!!

name: John O'Leary
text:
Excellent.  My pain was been going on since the 70s, a week after surgery it is much better.

Strongest possible recommendation for his practice.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, John! We're thrilled that you had a great experience with us, and thankful that you took the time to share your praise with others.

name: Marcus Hughes
text: I’ve been treated by Dr Krauss for both an ankle fusion and also a leg shortening procedure. I have been well pleased and highly recommend him. His staff has always been very courteous and accommodating.  A great bunch of folks!

name: Tim Roper
text: I had let my type II diabetes get out of control to the point of unfortunately needing a toe amputation. Dr. Krauss did the procedure after setting up surgery (shunts to improve blood flow through my groin). I was a smoker up until that point. Dr. Krauss was a straight shooter throughout the whole thing. I was fortunate that I didn't loose that foot or even a leg. He emphasized no more smoking.  Sad that it took getting to this point to be ready.  In a nutshell, Dr. Krauss and Dr. Heideprem (vascular surgeon) saved my life and I will be forever grateful to them.

resp.text: We appreciate the rating, Mr. Roper. Thank you!

name: Hyron Duff
text: Dr.Krauss and his staff were very knowledgeable and pleasant to deal with.

resp.text: Thanks for the kinds words, Hyron! It's exciting to hear that you had a quality experience with us.

name: Christa Cummins
text: Even though I’m going through this crazy ordeal, they are so Thorough and do not skip any steps. Dr Krauss is awesome and is worried about my well-being not about the Workmen’s Comp. people hurrying me back to work. Thank you to his team for everything y’all are doing for me!

name: Kathy Herron
text: Dr Krass staff + Him make my visit very pleasant .

name: Janice Littleton
text: My visit yesterday went very smoothly. I filled out all the paperwork online prior to going for my appointment. When I arrived, I signed in and had a short wait time to be called back to see the Dr. The Dr explained what was going on with my foot and we have a treatment plan.  I am pleased with this facility 100 percent!

name: BILL VERNON
text: Dr. Krauss,& his staff are Truly dedicated Professional medical people,Very Happy with My treatment,& would refer Anyone 2 them 4 Treatment !!!, Bill Vernon

name: Lynn Nixon
text: Dr Krauss and Nurses are always nice and caring. I enjoy my visits, because they are healing me.

name: Gregory Cochran
text: Dr.Krauss is a stern but very fair and caring doctor. Did his best, to get me through a very trying time of my life with diabetes. I thank God for doctors like him.

name: Matt Collier
text: We had a great experience. The staff were all very friendly. Dr.krauss is so nice and down to earth. We know he cares for each of his patients.

name: M Chambers
text: I know it is close to the holidays but I was disappointed I have to make another trip (60miles one way) just to have a CT scan done Then wait again for another trip just to get the results. Doctor was great , personal was very nice but it did seem like a waste of time just to cut one cast off then put another one on , then send me home.

name: Carl Oneal
text: Dr. Krauss' staff was wonderful, upon arrival l was greeted as if I'd been a patient of his for years. In the exam room my questions were answered to my satisfaction and my procedure was explained in detail. He and his staff were very professional and l felt at ease even though l had to go to the office alone that day. I'm not at all apprehensive about having my procedure.

name: Bunny Lawson
text: The staff was really nice. The doctors were patient, and listened to my concerns. I had an awesome experience.

name: Angie L.
text: The people at the front desk were very polite, the nurses and Dr. Krauss were exceptional and caring as always!

name: Rhonda Lyn
text: After several bone breaks and surgeries, Dr. Krauss and his staff always hae treated me in the most professional and personal manner. the accommodations for appointments at Grandview or Valleydale are flexible for my schedule.

name: Melinda Lewis
text: Overall experience was excellently! The staff took real good care of my needs and the D r. Krause he made sure that all my questions and concern was answer.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text: After months and 4 other doctors, Dr Krauss was able to nail down a diagnosis and the reason I could not walk in less than 15 minutes. He quickly scheduled a MRI and referred me to a spine specialist. He gave me hope and a path to recovery and living again. Words can’t describe how thankful I am .

name: LP Key
text: Dr. Krauss is an excellent physician/surgeon. He and his staff are very knowledgeable and compassionate to the needs of their patients.

name: ONeal Smitherman
text: I was treated very well, with professionalism and respect.

name: Sheri McReath
text: All staff, from the receptionist to Dr. Krauss, are always so responsive to my medical needs and always sweet and polite. I recommend Dr. Krauss to everyone.  My only complaint, and it is minor, is the 30 minute wait time in the lobby .

name: James Mcmillian
text: Very little pain so far.

resp.text: Thanks for the rating, James! We're happy that you've had a great experience with us.

name: Lachelsea Hall
text: I really enjoy the staff and the way Dr Krauss gives positive feedback. From my first visit he has been helpful and I really appreciate him for taking the time to help me heal and I pray that he will continue to give the best care that he can to his patients. Thanks Dr Krauss

name: Laura Louise Gentry
text:
First time at Grandview & my first time seeing Dr. Krauss. I went in for a painful heal yesterday, I couldn't take the pain any longer. After Dr Krauss made his diagnosis of a heal stress fracture & his recommendation of how to relief the pain by wearing a tall boot for 8 weeks, I'm feeling much better today.
Thank you staff & Dr. Krauss

name: Cathy Skipworth
text: Dr Krause was always so kind and kept me up to date with my progression healing is a process.   He was phenomenal

name: Karen Henderson
text: Dr. Krauss has been my husband's surgeon for several years.  We know we can trust his professional opinion and are very confident in the care he and his staff provide.  We highly recommend him.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Kay
text: Dr. Krauss is tending to both my and my husband's feet.  He is very thorough, concerned, wants to help you get better and has a wonderful personality.  All is his staff is excellent as well.  They all strive for excellence and make you feel special as a patient.  Dr. Krauss is one of those doctors that you never dread having to see.  We highly recommend him.

name: Betty Veitch
text:
The entire staff at SouthLake Orthopedics is not only professional, but they appear to enjoy their jobs. Dr. Krauss is not only professional, he is honest with his patients regarding prognoses; something I find refreshing.
He includes those family members you wish to have included in your care, to the extent you wish to have them included and he is mindful of family situations outside the office that may have a bearing on your care, but he leaves that final decision about your care up to you once he is sure you can make a truly informed decision.  WONDERFUL!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Bill West
text: Great experience with Dr. Krauss.  Would definitely recommend him.

name: Jenny Camp
text: He was fast and very kind.  His office staff were very busy but took time to talk to me and answer questions with a smile.

name: Carmen Bates
text:
10/2020
Still absolutely incredible! If you are having problems this is definitely a doctor you can trust to do what will the best for you. We’ve had quite the ongoing journey due to the extensive boo boo from the fall from the heavens. He is incredible! His expertise is incredible!
Updated 7/10/20
Returned again to see Dr. Krauss due to the natural progression of my injury . I’m a year and 3 months post fall from a high ladder. I still feel that with Dr. Krauss I receive the best care I could ever get from a doctor. He was given a mangled mess and today I walk and am living a life I honestly thought I never would. I will be forever grateful to Dr. Krauss and the years he has taken to master his craft.

I feel that with Dr. Krauss I have and will continue to receive the best of care. He is very detailed and thorough whether it’s an office visit or a surgery. No doubt he is the absolute best. He has made a horrible accident somewhat bearable with his knowledge and skill.

name: Patsy Turner
text: Very professional and informative. It was a new patient appointment and I’m very pleased!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.

name: Matt Kellum

The wait time to see Dr. Krauss is reasonable and his staff is always friendly and helpful.

text: My dad saw dr ridgeway. Love him! Well worth the wait. What a gem.  He answered all of my dads and my questions with total patience. 🙏🏼

name: Ann Shortis
text:
Disorganized,fired too many experienced staff leaving mostly young inexperienced staff. Expect long waits from over booking patients.We waited almost 2 hours on more than one occasion due to staff inability to triage patients,forgetting to sign patients in on arrival,not allowing appropriate time for new patients to be seen.Just to name a few.
Also,for months we have heard "our fax machine is old and doesn't work right". I suspect the staff cannot trouble shoot or even work it if the "go" button doesn't work the first time..or it is an extremely old machine that needs replacing and no one wants to spend money on it..faxes have mysteriously gotten "lost" far too often  to be just an accident. We have to go in person and stand at the counter and complain to get anything for another Dr to see.
The technician/Drs who read the CT results are 100% unreliable. 2 ct's can read wildly different even within a couple of days of each other. The X-ray situation is soso.
Staff with minimal in house training take the various scan,ultrasounds etc  and readings..

Mainly,it's a crapshoot on care here.Which has gotten much worse since our Dr died in a 4by4 accident.
I say avoid if at all possible

text: My mother goes to this practice and her Dr is awesome, but the office part is unorganized, rude, and plain unprofessional. It makes you wonder how in the world the people at the front desk even got their degree or if they are educated. It is a nightmare to try to get a refill on a medication. It's impossible. The only way to get them is when you actually see the doctor.. if you forget to get a refill when you see the doctor well your screwed until the next month basically. We live about a hour away from there so we can not just go by there everyday trying to get one refill. Today I called about a refill and have been trying to get this refill now for over a week and eventually instead of helping me they hung up on me. I just am beyond aggravated. My mom really likes her dr and his nurse is so sweet, but it's getting to the point that I'm seriously considering finding her another doctor bc of the fact everything about the front desk is just so unprofessional. When we gofor my mother's appt I'm going to complain about this and try to get a number that is a direct line to my mom's Dr or his nurse. I advise anyone who's thinking about coming to this practice to find another Dr office. It you are a new patient it's not worth the hassle

name: Janice Nix
text: They are professional, and have patience. They really work with you to get your health in order.

name: K
text: At 19 years old I became a patient of Brad Ginevan MD. After my current pediatrician, Dr. Rivas, advised it was time to transition to an adult provider. During the time he was my provider, Dr. Ginevan worked alongside my psychiatrist to continue maintenance of my ADHD and when necessary, he worked with specialists to manage my delicate GI condition. This included references to appropriate clinics and scheduling of applicable tests ie. Colonoscopy, EGD, etc. I truly trusted Dr. Ginevan and was incredibly grateful to have found such a wonderful physician. I never minded the fact that his office was always moving locations or that his appointments had become a nightmare to secure. I still referred only my closest of friends and family to see him. Always assuring them they'd be nothing less than satisfied with him as they're provider. Those were the old days... in 2013 I moved away to live on base with my then husband. I moved back in 2015 and returned to Dr. Ginevan. He and his staff had undergone a complete restructuring as they were now a part of the mega-merger trend and had merged with the tri-cities health giant Shoals Primary Care LLC. Due to the merger Dr. Ginevan no longer had any of my previous medical records from all of my time spent under his care which led to massive complications to my continuity of care. (I now understand the importance of my responsibility to secure medical history documentation and maintain my own current updated personal medical record.) Also, SADLY, due to the implementation of a governmental-esque standard of operating procedures, it is my opinion that Dr. Ginevan no longer maintained the level of patient care he had became known for. His office staff has always been grade-A; to be commended. If you are considering seeing Dr. Ginevan as your primary care provider this review is for you. In closing I want to say that this review in no way, intends to slander or cause malice. This review is my personal experiential reference/opinions of Dr. Ginevan meant solely for the purpose of socially informing fellow peers.

name: Shelby Stanford

name: Diamond Love
text: Dr Karr is a wonderful doctor.  He really cares about his patients well being.

name: Em Means
text: I had planned to start seeing Dr. Martin as a new patient after my husband's first visit (where they had down on his chart that he was a 60 year old female with impacted bowls). I ignored that fact and still decided to give the doctor the benefit of the doubt because I could understand things sometimes happen. However, upon my scheduled visit as a first time patient it was for 7:30 am, and I arrived at 7:15 am for new patient paper work. I signed in and no one even showed up at the front desk until my appointment time, where I  then asked for my paper work and filled it out. About ten minutes after that, another woman called me by the wrong name and when I corrected her, I was made to feel as if I had done something wrong. Also, you can not hear when you are being called because the TV is loud, so people are talking over the TV, and I have two ear infections. After filling out my paper work, I was then called back to the window, where I was asked to write down my SSN, but I had already written it down twice on the form already. This told me they obviously were not paying attention to the information they were entering. After this, and already feeling on edge from just the front desk experience, I am called back by the doctor's nurse practitioner who tells me to step on the scale, and with a horrible tone says, "you're going to have to take some of that off." Meaning my purse. I ask where I should put it in case of a designated area, which seem to make her even more annoyed and she replies with, "I don't know." Very snappy. I am a new patient and felt like I was asking a very simple and non offensive question. We then walk to the exam room where she informs me that I would not be seeing the doctor and that he also would never been doing my exams or ever seeing me other than a quick peek in the room. Which, as someone looking for a long term doctor, it does not feel comfortable not even meeting my doctor on the first visit. When I tried to explain that I was uncomfortable with the fact she would only be relaying my issues to the doctor, and that I didn't feel comfortable having my health looked after in third person, and that I didnt understand why they wouldn't tell a new patient to begin with when making an appointment that he or she won't be seeing a doctor. She then got upset about it and told me I could reschedule or abort because she had been doing this for 40 years. Which is fine and I explained to her I was fine with her seeing me, but that I didn't feel comfortable having a doctor diagnose me without speaking with me and knowing me as a person. She gets more upset and I said I think it would be best just to cancel because at that point, being someone who has been diagnosed with a generalized anxiety disorder, I was overwhelmed and ready to go home. She proceeded to then say to me, "Fine then. Adios." I feel as if the entire situation was unprofessional on many different levels. I decided to keep searching for a new doctor. I would not advise this practice if you want to get to know your doctor for long term use, or have anxiety issues, seeing as how it is the only doctor's office I have ever been in where the lobby is loud and over packed.

name: Samantha Smith
text: Well where do I start.... First I guess I could start off with the fact the receptionist are very rude. Next I am being seen by Dr Aaron karr aka his assistant for a blood clot in my liver. So as I'm being processed for my visit the nurse asks me." Ma'am which side is your blood clot on".........eeerrrmmm. unless I have 2 livers it is on my right side. I over looked that. NEXT , I go in for my inr check and my levels are still below standard so he send me to Hellen Keller to do bloodwork and says he will call with the results. No call..... Instead I call up there later in the day and she says you need to come pick up you medicine. So I go get it they have switched my medicine with no telling me no nothing I am a breastfeeding mother. He switched me to a medicine that I cannot breastfeed on without any consultation. I had to Google the risks and side effects. Totally unprofessional and a headache. I will be switching doctors asap!

name: Gregory Eagerton
text: I saw Dr. Smith at his Grandview office as a new patient this past Friday.  Excellent experience.  Reception at front desk professional, personable, and efficient.  Was called to exam room within 10 minutes of appointment time.  Seen first by his PA who was also very professional, efficient, and personable.  X-Ray ordered and completed within 10 minutes.  Dr. Smith came to room within five minutes of X-ray completion, examined hand, discussed options for treatment, and decisions made to move forward with surgery.  Surgery scheduler walked in behind Dr. Smith and within minutes my surgical procedure was on the books and the visit was complete.  I am confident I got excellent care by the team, will have a successful procedure this week, and was treated by professionals with the respect and integrity all patients expect.  As a healthcare professional that's been in the "business" for over 30 years, I know quality when i see it and i saw it during this visit!

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: B. L.
text:
My mother is the patient of Dr. Smith for 7 months thus far. She broke her elbow. Dr
Smith and his staff are very caring, polite,  courteous and professional.  She received excellent care. Dr. Smith always speaks words of encouragement.  She has done very well.

resp.text: Glad to hear she is doing well.  Thank you for the response.

name: Rhonda Gant
text: Referred to Dr Smith by the Emerg Room Doc at Grandview after falling and breaking my hand. Dr Smith and his entire staff at Southlake Orthopaedics Sports Medicine & Spine Center on Valleydale Road (near I-65) have been awesome. By allowing me to complete much of my paperwork and completing the checking process online using my smartphone, I’ve had very minimal wait time. Xrays have been quick and are completed onsite, as is the therapy/rehab office where they made my splint in only minutes. All the staff from check in, rehab, X-ray, PA, nursing, all the way to Dr Mitch have been just the nicest most caring people. Too bad I’d have to break another bone just to come back! 🤣 Great staff, location, and overall experience. I’m grateful, and will highly recommend them to all my friends and family.

resp.text: Thank you for the nice feedback!

text:
The doctor April Jones was amazing that’s where the two stars come from.

If you are considering purchasing eyeglasses from this location DON’T! I have received nothing but the runaround from this location. My vision is definitely not a priority to them. I’ve waited almost two months. Still no glasses after paying for the glasses on April 23. I will never order glasses from this location again. I will however continue to see the doctor there. None of this is her fault.

resp.text: Lacricia, I'm Cassie. I'm so glad you were happy with Dr. Jones, and so sorry about these issues with your glasses! This is definitely not the experience we want you to have. I'd like to look into how this happened -- could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

HOWEVER, the optician (glasses lady) refuses to give the pd number which is a measurement needed to order your own glasses online for cheaper. It's a part of your prescription/medical info and there's no part of your health information that you would not be able to obtain.

Problem was resolved. Great job by the office manager.

text: We had a great time here! They ripped out my daughters adenoids with prejudice! Super fast and efficient. The staff were all great and with my daughters emotions... and with ours. 5stars
