text: Our son had a tonsils removal surgery week ago.  We showed up on time and they took us in on time, paper work was super easy, they explain everything very clear, checked on us to make sure we knew exactly what was going on with surgery. After the surgery they explained everything very clear as well, very pleased with all the staff and our dr.

name: Katelyn Harris
text:
The Doctors are fantastic at this clinic so is the nurses that do weight and measurements, but the behind the scene work that would return a fax so that you could follow through with your HR to be off work with your child for an upcoming seizure surgery don’t expect any help or compassion because you will not receive it.
Rosemary.

name: Zac Evans
text:
My 15 month old daughter had tear duct surgery on Wednesday, Sept. 18th. After surgery, the doctor said it’ll be about 30 minutes in recovery. As my wife was pacing back and forth outside our room door, about an hour to an hour and a half went by without being informed of anything that was going on with our daughter. Finally the anesthesiologist came and told us that she was dehydrated and had to stick her multiple times for an IV. We get our daughter back and saw some of the IV sticks on her and brought her home to find even more than we thought there were. They stuck my 15 month old child around 59 different times trying for an IV. They stuck her in both wrists, hands, arms, feet, ankles, inner thigh, center of her stomach, side of her stomach, and her neck. No baby should have to be stuck that many times to try for an IV. I have pictures to prove it. She’s had bruises all of her body for about a week now bc of all the needle sticks. I just can’t imagine sticking a baby with a needle almost 60 times and being okay with it.. We are waiting on getting the medical records to see everything. I sure hope they didn’t use the same needle a lot of those times. I’ve been told that can cause infections.

I told my aunt that has been a nurse for 41 years and she said she has never seen anything like that in her whole career as a nurse and a she works with babies in the NICU everyday. Even some of her doctors were astounded by looking at the images and seeing how many times they stuck her. They have not compensated us for anything...

name: Karah Christian
text:
Happened to come on the 20th anniversary today! 7/17/2019. The lobby was packed, but still great and quick service! The lobby front desk was nice and helpful. They had clowns for face painting, Mardi gras beads they gave my boys, and Urban Popsicles outside on the curb! Made for an unexpected surprise during a random trip here for our first time.

(I do recommend that the baby changing table in the women’s be replaced to something newer! The strap was broken and the table is not level, it’s falling down.)

We were referred from our Pediatrician for X-ray on my 1 year olds ankle/leg. X-ray floor was so cute with its ocean theme! The X-ray technicians, nurses, and staff were all sweet and helpful. Both us parents were allowed in the room to help hold him and keep his attention, and that made it a lot easier on us and him! The rooms themes on the walls were just the most awesome thing to my 7 year old. They made us feel so welcome and we were in and out of there within 45 minutes! Didn’t keep track just looked at the time we got back in the car from the time we arrived. I recommend! Not sure why I’ve never been here cause I’ve been to every other hospital around. But it was a good experience!

name: Ray Golden
text: Great place the doctors are very respectful very polite and very quick and professional I recommend children's of Alabama to everyone

name: Miranda Gwin
text: It's very clean! I love coming here the Nurses are outstanding!! Very friendly and fast service! The Nurses make the appointments fun and fast! Thanks for your service!

name: Frantasia Johnson
text: I had my surgery here yesterday I had a great experience I had some of the sweetest nurses and everybody was so welcoming made me feel right at home thanks to everyone up there that made me feel comfortable  Y’all are the best !!

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text: I've undergone two surgical procedures here at Outpatient Carecenter, and I only have positive things to say. It is conveniently located in the city center. They are very friendly, and they do not waste your time, as they try to move the process along at a progressive pace. Pre and post-op nurses are fabulous! The only gripe I have is that after one of my surgeries, the were putting pts back into the pre-op holding area after leaving PACU (recovery room), and it was made extremely loud, but only by family members that were sitting with pts after their procedures; I felt as if the nurses should've shut down the loud talking and laughing because who wants to be constantly disturbed while trying to rest/sleep after surgery. Other than that, I have only good things to say about Outpatient Care center!

name: Ann Marie Granberry
text: I had my first surgery experience here. I was so nervous going in, but everyone there was so friendly and reassuring!

name: Co Yeoman
text: Not the best experience there is room for improvement

name: Bill Brooks
text: Terrible wait time!!!

name: Patty Henderson
text: Wonderful!

name: Joseph Berry
text: Wow great

name: Life in Camo Media, LLC
text: We have used Jackson Surgery Center three times in the last two years and every visit was a positive experience. The staff is friendly, the nurses are kind and knowledgeable about every procedure we were there for. The staff kept the family/driver informed the entire time the patient was there. The billing department was very easy to work with. I was able to get someone on the phone every time I called to get an insurance issue resolved. I would highly recommend Jackson Surgery Center to anyone that needs the type service they offer. I would give them 10 stars if it were possible.

name: Janice Howell
text: I had a great experience with my kind and caring nurses at my pre-surgery and recovery room time. I'd like to thank Cherri, Philanda and Cheryl personally for their great work. They made sure I was comfortable. As for as the surgery, the anesthesiologist and surgeon made sure I was knocked out for the 7 stitches although I didn't choose to be. Doctor was very late so he didn't want to waste any time. Maybe it was for the best but it was definitely not my choice.

name: Russell Marks
text: I was schedule for a colonoscopy on Mar 4th.  I was notified that I had to report to Surgery Center for Covid 19 test prior to having the procedure.  I called the doctor's office to see if I could have it done in Prattville area as I lived North of Prattville and was told to call Jackson Surgery Center, I did and they said that would be fine.  So I got the test and a letter saying  I had a negative result.  Then next day I get a call from JSC saying what I had was not good enough.  I was asked why I didn't get tested at JSC and explained that it was more convient to have it locally.  She stated that she lived south of Montgomery and came to work every day.  This really upset me!  Long story short I had already spent a whole afternoon getting tested and by the time she called had already begun the prep and had to cancel the procedure.  They need to get better people friendly personal    to contact patients and get there act together as far as what is acceptable covid testing.  I had this procedure at the JSC (prior to Covid) and it was a great experience just glad I didn't have contact with this person back then.

resp.text:
Mr. Marks, thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any confusion.  We will address this issue with our staff, the response you received certainly isn't our expectation. For future reference we have Important Covid Information on our website. You can find it here to review our policies.

https://www.jscal.com/blog/covid-19-information/
If you have further issues or questions please contact our director Missy Sallas 334-293-8484

name: Lisa Hudspeth
text: Better check to see what you owe or they will not do the operation.  They never told me the countless times I’ve spoken with them.  They were extremely hateful.  I asked what I needed and they said insurance card and license.  I drove 4.5 hours and they were going to cancel on me!

name: Vernon Hunter
text: We had a wonderful experience here. Very welcoming and professional. The ladies at the front desk were very nice and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive feedback.  Our team will be really happy to hear you noticed.   Thank you!

name: Rosilind Maxwell
text: I just wanted to tell everyone how much I appreciated you all for being so gracious and concerned about the experience that I had with you all on October 21st. You made an unnerving and uncomfortable situation pleasant and endearing.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart. God bless each and everyone that works in that entire building.

resp.text: We thank you and are very happy to have had a positive impact on your experience.  Thank you for your kind words we will share this with our team.  With sincere appreciation. Take Care!

name: Jason York
text:
We were surprised by having to pay a second co-pay, one for the facility for the doctor. It was explained that this is because the doctor is not affiliated and it is an out patient surgery. However, the doctor's name is listed as part owner, not to mention the fact that we have had out patient surgeries in the past and not had separate co-pays. We will not be using this facility again, as it appears to be using any way possible to take money. We could have refused, but we already had the time scheduled off work, and it's hard to rearrange a surgery. At the very least, they could have let us know this in advance, instead of at the time of the surgery. We will be using the Baptist hospital system from now on.

Update: No, it wasn't really addressed, we were just told that we would have to pay again or reschedule. It's not about the money, it's about letting us know in advance that there are two separate co-pays, which was not done.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we apologize for any miscommunication. Our administrative team is aware of the concern and has addressed this with the patient.  If you need future assistance or have further questions about our billing policies, please contact our Administrator Mr. John Gray 334-293-8484

name: Barbara Sowell
text: Great experience! Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!

name: leo zemke
text: I am glad everyone else had such a fantastic experience at this place but they almost let my step son DIE!  He came in and was scheduled for exploratory surgery to fix SHODDY WORK DONE BY DR CHANDLER during a sinus polyp surgery and my step son began to pour blood from his Sphenopalatine Artery and the office was more worried about getting another three hundred dollar copay out of us than helping my son.  My wife had to scream for help in the office to get nurses and a doctor to get my son and help him.  We were treated shabbily during the whole ordeal.  My step son was bleeding to death and they did not even have the ability to  give him blood at this facility.  They almost killed him!  IT WAS HORRIBLE!  A HORRIBLE ORDEAL!!!!  I should post photos of all the blood.  The clinic manager was not friendly, everyone acted as if they did not know what was going on or what to do.  They had to take my son by ambulance over the the hospital and then the nightmare continued.  The ER doctor threw my son out of the hospital room that he was scheduled to be in.  It was like they tried to kill my son and then they were trying to sweep us under the carpet or out the door.  TO HIDE US AND THE HORRIBLE THINGS THEY DID AND THE WAY THEY ALMOST KILLED MY SON!!!   It was a nightmare!  They were going to give my son a blood transfusion in the ER and sweep us out the door.  MY WIFE HAD TO ENLIST THE HELP OF THE AMBULANCE DRIVERS Who could see that our son was in agony and practically DEAD AT THEIR HANDS!  The ambulance drivers GOD BLESS THEM talked the angry, crazy doctor into keeping our son and putting us in a room for the night.  This was the worst thing that has ever happened to our family.  I would not allow this clinic to operate on a PET COCKROACH if I had one!  PLEASE BEWARE!!!

resp.text: Dear Leo, we sincerely apologize for your experience with the Jackson Surgery Center.  We strive to provide the highest level of care equally to all of our patients.  We appreciate your feedback and are addressing the issues mentioned with our administrative team.  We promise to also forward your concerns to the Jackson Hospital Administration.  Our commitment to protecting patient privacy disallows us to discuss this in an open forum.  Please do not hesitate to contact our administrator John Gray at 334-293-8484

name: Whitney Boutwell
text: Very organized...very clean

resp.text: Thank you Whitney!  We appreciate your observations and are happy to provide healthcare services to you and your loved ones.  I’ll share your comments with our team. Happy Friday!

name: Carol Roberts
text: My husband and I have both been here for minor outpatient procedures. We could not be more impressed with this facility and can enthusiastically recommend it to anyone needing surgery. We both had excellent care while we were there. The nurse even gave me novacaine before placing an IV in my hand (totally unnecessary, but I appreciate the thoughtfulness). I had some questions about anesthesia, and they actually brought the anesthesiologist to me to answer my concerns. After care and instructions were good.

resp.text: Carol we so appreciate your observations.   Thank you for noticing the “little” things we do to make your outpatient experience favorable.  Speedy recovery!  We will check on you soon!

name: Michelle Swofford
text: They took excellent care of my daughter and staff was super friendly.   She had an excellent nurse in recovery.   Everything is very organized from registration to discharge.

name: Keri Chaney
text: This was my first procedure done here. Wonderful staff, very professional. Pleasant experience.

resp.text: Thank you!  We appreciate your kind words and will share with our staff.  Have a super recovery!

text: First class service.  5 star rating.

I highly recommend their service.

name: david crawford
text: My experience with Dr. Craig was outstanding!!!  He was prompt, very courteous, and is a real pro with injections.  I received an injection in each knee.  He is so smooth, I never did feel a thing!

name: Alicia Johnson
text: Once my name was called they took great care of me. I didn’t have to wait long for the x-ray and also I didn’t have to wait long for the results from the doctor.

name: Cheryl Thomas
text: Dr. Craig and his staff were very thorough and explained what was going on with my particular problem in great detail. I feel so confident in the care they provide.

name: M Godwin
text: Until today my review of Dr. Craig was quite positive.  However the day I was I’m affordably detained on my way to my appointment this resulted in me being 10 minutes late, I did however call before my appointment time to tell them I had been delayed. I did not know I needed to get a name of the person I spoke to. By the time I was able to check in because I had to stand in line to use their kiosk to check in I was right at 15 minutes late. I was then told that Dr. Craig had a strict 15 minute no-show rule. This resulted in having to reschedule my appointment after I had driven 20 miles to get here and now I have to return in the morning. I have waited much longer than 15 minutes after my appointment time on occasion and yes I was very irritated when I was told there was no grace available.

name: Morrie Chance
text: Friendly environment with knowgeable staff.  Dr Craig took the time to explain to me my spinal issues and suggested certain avenues to help resolve the pain from my spinal arthritis.

name: Jan King
text: I felt very comfortable because I knew of the expertise of Dr. Craig and all his staff. Beyond being outstanding in their field , they were so friendly and thoughtful of me , making me feel like I was receiving excellent care in every respect. I love to share this with my friends who need this kind of help because I know they will be well taken care of.

name: Patrica Turner
text: I was referred to Dr Craig for a tendon injection which I had yesterday. Waiting and hoping this is going to relieve the pain I have been in for months. He was just so kind in making sure he wasn’t hurting me. The RT working with him was awesome. There was a third person in the room she just stood back and said nothing. Would like to have known what her purpose was. I would recommend Dr Craig in a heartbeat.

name: Debbie Keen
text: Dr. Craig takes the time to make sure I understand the underlying problem and gets to the main objective which is what's causing my pain and this is how we fix it! I appreciate how I I never have to wait long in the treatment room or waiting room! His office is run efficiently! I would highly recommend him!!

name: Ronald Dewberry
text: Office personnel were very efficient and courteous. Dr Craig and nurse practitioner were very concerned and reviewed my case and helped me to make a decision on my treatment!

name: Stephanie Brown
text: I always have a fantastic experience with Dr. Craig and his staff. They truly care about their patients and it shows. And he has the best bed side manned.

name: Monica Brown
text: Everyone in the office from front to back, check in to check out make me feel I'm most important. Dr. Craig is great.  I highly recommend this office.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text:
I refer to Dr. Craig as a medical detective. I had seen several physicians that could not figure out what was wrong with me. He discovered that I have a very rare neurological disorder. Without his knowledge and expertise, I could have suffered years with this with no help from the medical community.

My first couple of visits, I wasn’t sure how I felt about him. But I grew to really appreciate not only the physician, but the type of man he is. He tried his best to help me with a nerve block. That did not work for me. He could have done a series of them. But he did not. He knew that wasn’t what was best for me. He is not trying to line his wallet. Dr. Craig recommended another option that he doesn’t perform, nor does Southlake. Despite having to refer me, he is still looped in on the process and making sure I get the care I need. My case is proof, he is going to find what is wrong and do what is best for his patients.

name: Lynette Mantooth
text: Excellent care and results..... wonderful staff!!

name: Rashelle Townsend
text: Dr. Craig as well as his staff are always very caring with me. I am grateful for his knowledge and talents he provides not only me but all his patients. Our paths crossed at an appointed time in my life at the young age of sixty-nine. Thank you 🙏🏽Dr. Craig!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

name: Brent Curtin
text: Couldn’t be more understanding and helpful. Although we are struggling to find a solution, you can tell they care and want to help. Everyone is amazing from the front staff all the way to Dr Craig.

resp.text: Thank you for the review.  Our goal is to provide excellent service!

name: Patricia Brown
text: The atmosphere is very nice and the staff is very courteous and you don’t have to wait long before seeing the doctor. Awesome service!!

name: Donna Vaughn
text: Dr Craig is very compassionate and assesses my overall health and not just the problem I go in for before making a decision about which direction to proceed w medication, procedures, etc.

name: Marcia Neff
text: Dr Craig is extremely knowledgeable  in his area of expertise.  For me he considered interactions between a muscle relaxing and other medications that I take. Not all doctors do this.  When I receive an injection from him it always works.  The facilitator where he does the injections is also excellent   Medplex

name: Nichole Kee
text: I had two cervical nerve blocks. The second one has almost eliminated my nerve pain. I recommend Dr. Craig to anyone having back pain.

name: Lisa Morrison
text: My stepdaughter recommended Dr. Craig and I am so glad she did!  I have had back pain for a number of years.  I feel so much better.  I now have a spine specialist and I know with his continued help, I will get stronger.

name: Dianne Mills
text:
I arrived a little early and was taken back very quickly. Everyone in this office is very courteous and helpful.
Dr. Craig explains procedures very clearly and answers all questions with a great deal of patience.

name: Sherry Allison
text:
Dr Craig has been so good to me! One of his greatest attributes is he will sit and listen &
pays attention to everything you tell him. He is very thorough in doing all he can to figure out what is going on.  He did all tests to cover my complaints to insure we weren’t missing something! Want a dr who listens?
Dr. Craig certainly does and the whole staff is great!!!!  Been working towards a solution
from mid May and still trying to figure it out.
I had a nerve block yesterday 6/28/2018.

name: Brenda Mosley
text: Excellent experience totally everyone office personnel nursing staff and doctor

name: Aereal Runyans
text: I was referred to him for an intraarticular injection of my ankle. He was quick, efficient, and did a great job.

name: Jackie Jones
text: Dr Craig is such a wonderful doctor with a great bedside manner!

name: linda sitton
text: Very friendly staff. Dr Craig is professional, knows his stuff. Very pleased with my visit.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Tuiren Bratina (tab)
text: Dr. Craig is a wonderful doctor. The nurse practitioner, Micah, is excellent, too.

name: Ted Cragan
text: Arrogant. Completely missed my issue on the MRI. Tried to tell me what was wrong with me without listening to me.

name: C T
text: Dr. Craig’s extensive.knowledge base, ability to perform procedures he perfected at Mayo and diagnose disease states is unparalleled in this area.(partially due to his years of training at Mayo in Rochester, Minn) He is also compassionate, empathetic, and genuinely cares about you, his patient. He won’t stop until you are as painfree and back to “normal” as possible. When he enters the exam room, you immediately feel that he is seeing you as a complete person and not just another name in his day. Dr. Craig epitomizes everything you hope for when you are seeking answers to constant orthopaedic pain! He was able help me find relief when the majority of the physicians I saw couldn’t even diagnose my condition!! (I wish that my writing skill could describe this wonderful healer in a more fitting manner.)   Thank you Dr. Craig! I will be eternally grateful for you and your wonderful staff!! Sincerely, Cynthia Totty

name: Patricia Mokolo
text: This is what "The Best Healthcare" looks like!

name: Sherry Stephens
text: Dr. Craig always explains issues in an easily understandable manner.  I never have to wait long to see him and his staff is wonderful also.

name: Bob Cleveland
text: Everything has always been excellent!

name: bryan webb
text: Dr. Craig has great bedside manner. Shows great concern and compassion. Very knowledgeable and great at his job

name: Bryan McGuffey
text: Southlake Orthpedic is a well run organization.  Drs. Blum and Craig plus their entire staff are excellent.  Three surgeries and three spinal blocks with positive results plus several therapy sessions allow me to thank them.

name: Jan Crosson
text: I registered online the wait was brief! Went in was in pain talked with Dr. Craig about options went with procedure in office. Next day felt better than I had in weeks. Thank you Dr. Craig and staff

name: Kathleen Sanders
text: I liked my visit with Dr Craig and his staff.He listened to my concerns suggested some things for some of my other my problems he explained what he could do to start and see how that works n then go from there

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback.  We care about our patients and want to keep you informed regarding your health.

name: sharon brakefield
text: Dr. Craig and his staff are awesome

name: Kali Verzone
text: Staff is always caring and friendly

name: Nancy Iyer
text: Excellent!!, staff was very professional

name: Terrance D
text: Today, I had a lingual frenectomy. The entire staff was so nice and encouraging. I arrived at 7:00am and was discharged about 9:00am. It was a smooth transition from parking, to check-in, to pre-op, to post-op! A+ service and facility!

name: Lynn Hannah
text: The parking is a night mare, no parking lot, you have to park just where ever. My appointment was at 11:00. I was told to be there at 10.:00. I arrived at 9:45. I did not have my procedure until 12:30. The holding area was not to bad, the nurse were friendly & professional. Once I'm taken in for my procedure, I'm taken to a tiny room that is dirty & not enough room for the nurses to room around my bed. I'm told Dr. Dasher books every 15 minutes on Friday which explains why I'm waiting 2 hours starving... I had the same procedure done several years ago at a facility close to home & the experience was nothing like this. I won't use this place again. Even the lady they had in the parking lot taking your temp was rude & nasty. Just overall not a good experience. Save your self some issues & go else where.

name: Solomon Mitchell Jr
text: Had a Colonoscopy done here , my second one. These folks have the stuff together, the whole staff are true  professionals.The whole procedure went like clockwork Hey,if you have a choice pick this facility to have a procedure done.Great folks.

name: Claire
text: Less than -1 star.  Acute bacterial contamination requiring specialized care.  Not worth risking your health.  Go somewhere else.

name: Diane Alfano
text: Great staff, very efficient, no wait time in and out over all great experience!

name: John Higginbotham
text: They don’t plan to fail, just FAIL TO PLAN! My wife had to come here for a procedure that requires her not eating the night before and also requires the staff to call in prep items to the pharmacy. The staff not only didn’t do their simple job of calling the prep items into the pharmacy, but when my wife went for her appointment at 11am they told her it would be a while, and it took them until 3pm to get to her... terrible experience. Consider yourself warned about this place.

name: kendra williams
text: Everyone here is so very nice!! I have never been to a facility were EVERYONE you encounter is so nice. Thank you all and God Bless :-)

name: Honest Review Man
text:
I went to the Birmingham Surgery Center today for a colonoscopy.  I had one  performed at this facility 5 years ago.  The staff is wonderful - the front desk personnel, the pre and post op nurses, the anesthesiologist,  and the nurse anesthetist!  No one ever looks forward to having to go to a surgical center but this staff was incredible.  All of them were very kind and comforting!

This visit was set up through Birmingham Gastroenterology.  Dr Bluhm and his staff did a great job setting up the procedure and making sure
everything was lined up for me to have a successful test.

name: Sheila Niblett
text: I have had several pain blocks from here. I love the staff, Dr. Cash and his partner. I will continue to use them as long as they're around.
